properties.name: Katholische Sozialakademie
properties.description:de: Die Katholische Sozialakademie ist eine gesamtösterreichische Einrichtung der katholischen Kirche im Spannungsfeld von Politik und Bildung.

properties.name: Grüne Bildungswerkstatt (GBW) Wien
properties.description:de: Die Grüne Bildungswerkstatt Wien orientiert sich an einem Bildungskonzept, das Theorie und Praxis, Reflexion und Handeln, Form und Inhalt verbindet.

properties.name: Grüne Bildungswerkstatt Tirol
properties.description:de: Die Grüne Bildungswerkstatt ist die Bildungsorganisation der Tiroler Grünen.

properties.name: Mattersburger Kreis für Entwicklungspolitik an den österreichischen Universitäten
properties.description:de: Der Mattersburger Kreis, gegründet 1981, versteht sich als Dachverband der entwicklungspolitischen Forschung und Lehre an den österreichischen Hochschulen.

properties.name: Hof Stopar
properties.desription:de: Dieser Hof liegt kurz vor der slowenischen Grenze im Karawankenmassiv und dehnt sich über 17 ha steile Wiesen und Wald aus.

properties.name: Weltladen Linz
properties.description: Der Weltladen - das Fachgeschäft für den Fairen Handel - bietet auf 100 m² ein Vollsortiment an fairen Produkten. Ein Besuch lohnt sich nicht nur wegen dem handwerklich gerösteten Kaffee, den großteils biologischen Lebensmitteln und der öko-fairen Mode, sondern ist auch sehr inspirierend bei der Suche nach besonderen Geschenken. Handwerksarbeit, Taschen, Bücher oder Kosmetikartikel, die Auswahl ist vielseitig.

properties.name: Revital-Shop
properties.description: Wer alte Sachen eine neue Chance geben möchte, wird in dem fast 600 m² Shop bestimmt fündig. Vom ausgedienten Teddybären bis zu Geschirr oder einer Waschmaschine gibt es hier fast alles. Die Qualität ist gut und der Preis günstig.

properties.name: Sisi-Top
properties.description: Sisi-Top fertigt unverwechselbare, individuelle Kleidungsstücke und Accessoires, veredelt Ihre Lieblingsstücke mit Stickereien nach Ihren persönlichen Vorstellungen. Sisi-Top recycelt in Linz “Ausgedientes” zu ganz neuen Lieblingssachen und überrascht mit originellen Veranstaltungen und Workshops.

properties.name: Raumschiff Linz
properties.description: Der gemeinnützige und unabhängige Verein fördert die Eigeninitiative von jungen Kunst- und Designschaffenden und die gesellschaftliche und wirtschaftliche Anerkennung ihrer künstlerischen Arbeit im Dialog mit der Öffentlichkeit.

properties.name: Trödlerladen
properties.description: Unter dem Motto "Wiederverwenden statt wegwerfen" schlägt der Arge-Trödlerladen drei Fliegen auf einen Schlag. Es gibt Beschäftigung für Wohnungslose, wir tun etwas für den Umwelt­schutz und bieten ein günstiges Waren­angebot für sozial benachteiligte Menschen an. Es werden Wohnungsräumungen und Entrümpelungen durchgeführt. Möglichst viele Waren werden sortiert, teilweise bearbeitet und in den Verkaufsstellen wieder in Umlauf gebracht. Der "Abfall" wird getrennt und für Recycling aufbereitet. Mehr als 250 Menschen finden jährlich eine zeitweise Beschäftigung, die wöchentlich eingeteilt wird. Einige MitarbeiterInnen können über das Programm Jobimpuls der Stadt Linz längerfristig beschäftigt werden. Arbeitsmöglichkeiten gibt es von der Mithilfe beim Transport bis zum Verkauf.

properties.name: Leisenhofgärtnerei
properties.description: In der idyllischen Demeter-Gärtnerei kann nicht nur regionales Obst und Gemüse direkt vor Ort erworben werden, sondern auch GartenfreundInnen sind herzlich eingeladen beim Pflanzen und Ernten mit anzupacken. Fleißige Helferlein drüfen sich dann frisches Obst, Gemüse und Kräuter mit nach Hause nehmen. Außerdem sind Milchprodukte, Eier, Käse, Brot, Säfte uvm. von Partnerbetrieben des Hofs erhältlich. Die Leisenhof-Gärtnerei fördert bewusst stadtnahe Ernährung und betreibt außerdem zwei Gemeinschaftsgärten (Hofgarten, Petrinumgarten).

properties.name: Salon Buntspecht
properties.description: Im Salon Buntspecht kann man Handgemachtes von verschiedenen lokalen Künstlerinnen und Künstlern erwerben. Ein großer Teil der Schmuckstücke fällt dabei in die Kategorie Upcycling.

properties.name: Ernte Land Linz
properties.description: Steigen und Kisten stapeln sich mit buntem Obst und Gemüse. Von Äpfeln bis hin zur Stoppelrübe findet sich hier einiges, je nachdem was im Moment Saison hat. Bei Margarita Zauner kann jede/r sicher sein, dass die Waren einen kleinen ökologischen Fußabdruck haben. Bei ihr kommen Gewürze, Öle, Milchprodukte und Brot ein "Gesicht", denn ihre LieferantInnen kennt sie alle persönlich. Regional und Bio wird hier ganz groß geschrieben.

properties.name: Leisenhof Werkstatt
properties.description: Einen Ort zu haben, wo man Dinge reparieren und anfertigen kann, ist unglaublich wichtig. Auch die Möglichkeit dies gemeinsam tun zu können, ist hier bei uns grossgeschrieben. Wir haben diesen Raum von einem unbrauchbaren Abstellplatz wieder in eine Werkstätte verwandelt. Dabei haben wir die vorhandenen Sachen so gut es geht wiederverwendet.

properties.name: OpenLab Reininghaus
properties.description: Wir möchte hier heute einen Beginn für Beteiligung setzten, um einen lebendigen Stadtteil wachsen zu lassen, um vielfältige Interaktionen vor Ort zu initiieren und damit nachhaltige gemeinschaftliche Praktiken etablieren. Unsere Idee ist es, einen Rahmen für Gemeinschaftliches und Innovatives zu schaffen und aktiv an dem Prozess der Stadtwerdung mitzuwirken.

properties.name: Südwind Vorarlberg
properties.description: Südwind Vorarlberg versteht sich als Plattform für Menschen die für gerechte Lebens- und Arbeitsbedingungen und gegen Hunger und Ausbeutung eintreten wollen. Die Auswirkungen einer globalisierten Welt bringen immer mehr Herausforderungen mit sich. Diesen wollen wir gemeinsam begegnen.

properties.name: Südwind Salzburg
properties.description:
Seit 1979 steht Südwind ein für eine fundierte entwicklungspolitische Bildungs- und Öffentlichkeitsarbeit im Bundesland Salzburg.
Unser Ziel war in all diesen Jahren, globale Themen und Vernetzungen sichtbar und verständlich zu machen, diese  kritisch zu hinterfragen und einen lokalen und persönlichen Bezug herzustellen.

properties.name: Südwind Oberösterreich
properties.description: Südwind setzt sich als entwicklungspolitische Nichtregierungsorganisation seit über 35 Jahren für eine nachhaltige globale Entwicklung, Menschenrechte und faire Arbeitsbedingungen weltweit ein. Durch schulische und außerschulische Bildungsarbeit, die Herausgabe des Südwind-Magazins und anderer Publikationen thematisiert Südwind in Österreich globale Zusammenhänge und ihre Auswirkungen.

properties.name: Südwind Niederösterreich
properties.description: Südwind Verein für Entwicklungspolitik und globale Gerechtigkeit Niederösterreich ist eine Organisation für entwicklungspolitische Bildungs-, Forschungs- und Öffentlichkeitsarbeit.

properties.name: Südwind Steiermark
properties.description: Die Regionalstelle Südwind Steiermark betreibt auf regionaler Ebene Kampagnen, Öffentlichkeits- und Bildungsarbeit zu globalen Themen und engagiert sich für eine nachhaltige globale Entwicklung und die Einhaltung von Menschen- und Arbeitsrechten weltweit.

properties.name: Südwind Wien
properties.description: Wir streben das gute Leben für alle Menschen weltweit an. Das bedeutet für uns, den respektvollen Umgang mit Menschen, Umwelt und Ressourcen zu pflegen. Wir wollen in einer friedlichen Welt leben, in der überall faire Arbeits- und Lebensbedingungen herrschen, in der die Menschenrechte eingehalten werden und in der Ernährungsouveränität sichergestellt ist.

properties.name: Kostnixladen Gratkorn
properties.description: Das Projekt Kostnixladen will nicht nur aktiv GEGEN die Verschwendung und damit FÜR die Umwelt arbeiten sondern vor allem 'alten, abgelegten und unerwünschten' Dingen/Gegenständen ihren Wert und die Wertschätzung wieder zurück geben.

properties.name: Kostnixladen Klagenfurt
properties.description: Das Projekt Kostnixladen will nicht nur aktiv GEGEN die Verschwendung und damit FÜR die Umwelt arbeiten sondern vor allem 'alten, abgelegten und unerwünschten' Dingen/Gegenständen ihren Wert und die Wertschätzung wieder zurück geben.

properties.name: Kostnixladen Friesach
properties.description:
Kostnix und ist doch etwas wert.
Jeder kann etwas bringen oder etwas mitnehmen.

properties.name: Klimabündnis Burgenland
properties.description: Wir sind das größte kommunale Klimaschutz-Netzwerk Österreichs. Wir setzen lokale Klimaschutz-Initiativen und schützen gleichzeitig den Amazonas-Regenwald. Und das bereits seit 1990.

properties.name: Klimabündnis Kärnten
properties.description: Wir sind das größte kommunale Klimaschutz-Netzwerk Österreichs. Wir setzen lokale Klimaschutz-Initiativen und schützen gleichzeitig den Amazonas-Regenwald. Und das bereits seit 1990.

properties.name: Klimabündnis Niederösterreich
properties.description: Das Klimabündnis unterstützt Gemeinden, Schulen, Kindergärten und Betriebe bei ihrer lokalen Klimaschutz-Arbeit. Gemeinsames Ziel der globalen Partnerschaft mit Indigenen Völkern in Brasilien ist die Reduktion der Treibhausgase und der Schutz der Regenwälder.

properties.name: Klimabündnis Salzburg
properties.description: Wir sind das größte kommunale Klimaschutz-Netzwerk Österreichs. Wir setzen lokale Klimaschutz-Initiativen und schützen gleichzeitig den Amazonas-Regenwald. Und das bereits seit 1990

properties.name: Klimabründnis Steiermark
properties.description: Wir sind das größte kommunale Klimaschutz-Netzwerk Österreichs. Wir setzen lokale Klimaschutz-Initiativen und schützen gleichzeitig den Amazonas-Regenwald. Und das bereits seit 1990.

properties.name: Klimabündnis Vorarlberg
properties.description: Wir sind das größte kommunale Klimaschutz-Netzwerk Österreichs. Wir setzen lokale Klimaschutz-Initiativen und schützen gleichzeitig den Amazonas-Regenwald. Und das bereits seit 1990.

properties.name: Klimabündnis Wien
properties.description: Wir sind das größte kommunale Klimaschutz-Netzwerk Österreichs. Wir setzen lokale Klimaschutz-Initiativen und schützen gleichzeitig den Amazonas-Regenwald. Und das bereits seit 1990.

properties.name: Essbare Stadt Wels
properties.description: Die essbare Stadt Wels möchte den Lebensraum in der Stadt essbar machen. Öffentliche Beetanlagen im Stadtgebiet, wie Grünflächen und Hochbeete, sollen dem Anbau von Lebensmitteln dienen. Zusätzlich komplettieren Obstbäume und Beerensträucher die Angebotsvielfalt. Das Projekt geschieht in Abstimmung mit der Stadtverwaltung und der Stadtgärtnerei. Die Bewohnerinnen und Bewohnern von Wels werden für die Bepflanzung, Pflege und Ernte aktiv mit eingebunden. Bisher wurden sechs Hochbeete an verschiedenen Standorten in der Innenstadt bepflanzt.

properties.name: Gemüsefreude: Solidarische Landwirtschaft
properties.description: Wir sind eine junge Familie und bewirtschaften einen kleinen Bauernhof in Sattledt (nahe Wels, Oberösterreich) mit dem Schwerpunkt Gemüsebau. Wir bauen eine große Vielfalt an Gemüse und Kräuter für zur Zeit (Saison 2013) rund 20 Familien/Haushalte an und haben außerdem in unserem großen Obstgarten allerlei Kleingetier herumlaufen (Hühner, Schafe, Schweine, Hasen, Puten, Katzen, Ameisen).

properties.name: Die Kautschädln, Biohof Rosstauscher
properties.description: Zehn Familien, Paare und Einzelpersonen haben sich 2013 am Biobauernhof Rosstauscher in Lasberg zusammengefunden, um für eine Erntesaison biologisch zu gärtnern. Im Vordergrund steht der Gedanke der "Solidarische Landwirtschaft". Die Mitglieder bezahlen einen fixen monatlichen Erntebeitrag. Die Ernte und auch das Risiko eines Ernteausfalls werden zu gleichen Teilen auf alle Mitglieder aufgeteilt...

properties.name: Solawi Vöcklabruck
properties.description: Wir bauen seit 2014 Bio-Gemüse für eine fixe Anzahl an ErnteteilerInnen, in der Nähe von Vöcklabruck, an: eine besondere Form der Landwirtschaft: Solidarische Landwirtschaft SOLAWI Das Gemüsesortiment reicht von Blattgemüsen, Kohlgemüsen, Fruchtgemüsen bis hin zu Wurzelgemüsen. Das gesamte Angebot wird am Hof selbst angebaut, gepflegt, geerntet und gelagert. Wir legen dabei besonderen Wert auf biologische, samenfeste Sorten (von Reinsaat, Arche Noah, Bingenheimer Saatgut,…).

properties.name: Interkultureller Gemeinschaftsgarten Bad Ischl
properties.description: Der interkulturelle Gemeinschaftsgarten Bad Ischl wurde vom Projekt Wohnen im Dialog der Volkshilfe Flüchtlings- und MigrantInnenbetreuung initiiert und gemeinsam mit der OÖ Landesgartenschau Bad Ischl und vor allem von engagierten GärtnerInnen unterschiedlicher Nationalitäten ins Leben gerufen. Die erste Gartensaison findet im Rahmen der OÖ Landesgartenschau 2015 statt. In weiterer Folge soll der Garten in Selbstverwaltung von den GärtnerInnen geführt werden, wobei eine unterstützende Begleitung des Gartens durch Wohnen im Dialog Bad Ischl der Volkshilfe gegeben ist.

properties.name: Gemeinschaftsgarten Flüchtlingswohnheim der Volkshilfe
properties.description: Der interkulturelle Gemeinschaftsgarten Bad Ischl wurde vom Projekt Wohnen im Dialog der Volkshilfe Flüchtlings- und MigrantInnenbetreuung initiiert und gemeinsam mit der OÖ Landesgartenschau Bad Ischl und vor allem von engagierten GärtnerInnen unterschiedlicher Nationalitäten ins Leben gerufen. Die erste Gartensaison findet im Rahmen der OÖ Landesgartenschau 2015 statt. In weiterer Folge soll der Garten in Selbstverwaltung von den GärtnerInnen geführt werden, wobei eine unterstützende Begleitung des Gartens durch Wohnen im Dialog Bad Ischl der Volkshilfe gegeben ist.

properties.name: Nachbarschaftsgarten Otto Löwisiedlung
properties.description: Gemeinschaftsgarten in Wels

properties.name: "Ganivace" Gemeinschaftsgarten Ried im Innkreis
properties.description: Auf dem Gelände des ehemaligen Schulgartens der Bildungswerkstatt Knittlingerhof (private Montessorischule) entstand 2010 der IK Gemeinschaftsgarten als Projekt des Volkshilfe Integrationsbüros Ried im Innkreis. Wasseranschluß (eigener Brunnen) und eine Gartenhütte waren bereits vorhanden. Auch war ein Teil der Fläche schon eingezäunt. Die Hütte wurde vergrößert, Obstbäume und Beerensträucher wurden gepflanzt, ein Baumhaus gebaut und ein Spielgerät für die Kleineren gekauft. 2014 ist ein überdachter Koch-/Grillplatz geplant.

properties.name: Interkultureller Gemeinschaftsgarten Sierning
properties.description: Der Interkulturelle Gemeinschaftsgarten Sierning wurde von der Volkshilfe Flüchtlings- und MigrantInnenbetreuung – Wohnen im Dialog ins Leben gerufen. Große Unterstützung fand das Projekt auch durch die Marktgemeinde Sierning und den Lions-Club. Er ist einer von vier im Jahr 2014 im Rahmen des Projekts „Bunte Gärten“ in Oberösterreich entstandenen Gärten. Weitere Standorte sind Braunau, Schwertberg und Traun.

properties.name: Interkultureller Gemeinschaftsgarten Schwertberg
properties.description: Der Interkulturelle Nachbarschaftsgarten Neu Schwertberg wurde von der Volkshilfe Flüchtlings- und MigrantInnenbetreuung – Wohnen im Dialog ins Leben gerufen. Er ist einer von vier im Jahr 2014 im Rahmen des Projekts „Bunte Gärten“ in Oberösterreich entstandenen Gärten. Weitere Standorte sind Braunau, Steyr-Sierning und Traun. Fördergelder gab es vom Fonds Gesundes Österreich, Land OÖ, Bundesministerium und der Marktgemeinde Schwertberg.

properties.name: Nachbarschaftsgarten Albert-Schweitzer-Alee Traun
properties.description: Der Bunte Garten Traun wurde von der Volkshilfe OÖ ins Leben gerufen. Er ist einer von vier im Jahr 2014 im Rahmen des Projekts „Bunte Gärten“ in Oberösterreich entstandenen Gärten. Weitere Standorte sind Braunau, Steyr-Sierning und Schwertberg. Fördergelder gab es vom Fonds Gesundes Österreich und den jeweiligen „Gesunden Gemeinden“. Ziel ist es, den Leuten aus der Nachbarschaft des Gartens eine Möglichkeit zum Gärtnern zu bieten, aber auch Menschen aus verschiedenen Kulturkreisen und Herkunftsländern zusammenzubringen und dadurch Grenzen zu überspringen. Betreut wird der Garten von einer Mitarbeiterin des Integrationsbüros „mosaik“ der Volkshilfe Flüchtlings- und MigrantInnenbetreuung in Traun.

properties.name: Interkultureller Gemeinschaftsgarten
properties.description: Der Interkulturelle Gemeinschaftsgarten Braunau am Inn wurde von der Volkshilfe Flüchtlings- und MigrantInnenbetreuung – Wohnen im Dialog ins Leben gerufen. Er ist einer von vier im Jahr 2014 im Rahmen des Projekts „Bunte Gärten“ in Oberösterreich entstandenen Gärten. Weitere Standorte sind Traun, Steyr-Sierning und Schwertberg. Fördergelder gab es vom Fonds Gesundes Österreich, Land OÖ, Bundesministerium und der Stadt Braunau.

properties.name: Tauschkreis Exit Sozial
properties.description:
EXIT-sozial Tauschbörse beruht auf dem Prinzip der Nachbarschaftshilfe.Da die freiwillige, unbezahlte und gegenseitige Hilfe heute mehr den je notwendig, jedoch nicht mehr selbstverständlich ist, wurde das Projekt, damals noch time genannt, im Jahre 1999 von der VSG ins Leben gerufen. Im April 2015 wurde das Projekt von EXIT-sozial übernommen und in EXIT-sozial Tauschbörse umbenannt.
Um Tauschangebote in Anspruch zu nehmen, ist eine Mitgliedschaft notwendig. Man kann sich auch ONLINE anmelden! Die Teilnehmerinnen und Teilnehmer bringen eigenständig Dienstleistungen oder Sachleistungen ein, die in Punkten und nicht mittels Geld bemessen werden.

properties.name: Tauschbörse Ottensheim
properties.description: Die Tauschbörse Ottensheim ist eine Interessentengemeinschaft von Menschen, die ihre Talente (= Fähigkeiten, Dienste, Waren, Produkte) in einen gemeinsamen "Markt" einbringen und so nutzbar machen. Die Angebote und Nachfragen reichen von Babysitten und Rasenmähen bis hin zu Computer-Einschulung, Organisation von Seminaren, Supervision und mehr. Sogar eine CD mit Kindergeschichten wurde bereits produziert, wobei von der Texterstellung bis zum Layout und der Produktion alles von Ottensheimer Talenten bewerkstelligt wurde.

properties.name: Der Krems-Taler - Talente Tauschkreis
properties.description: Ein Tauschkreis bietet ein unvorstellbares Spektrum an Möglichkeiten. Es können Dienstleistungen, Waren, Lebensmittel, Tiere, Pflanzen, Bücher und vieles mehr getauscht werden. Der Tausch erfolgt über „Krems-Taler“. Erwirtschaftete Krems-Taler müssen nicht beim selben Tauschpartner eingelöst werden, was auch der seltenste Fall ist. Ein Tauschkreis bietet ein unvorstellbares Spektrum an Möglichkeiten. Es können Dienstleistungen, Waren, Lebensmittel, Tiere, Pflanzen, Bücher und vieles mehr getauscht werden. Der Tausch erfolgt über „Krems-Taler“. Erwirtschaftete Krems-Taler müssen nicht beim selben Tauschpartner eingelöst werden, was auch der seltenste Fall ist. Ein Tauschkreis bietet ein unvorstellbares Spektrum an Möglichkeiten. Es können Dienstleistungen, Waren, Lebensmittel, Tiere, Pflanzen, Bücher und vieles mehr getauscht werden. Der Tausch erfolgt über „Krems-Taler“. Erwirtschaftete Krems-Taler müssen nicht beim selben Tauschpartner eingelöst werden, was auch der seltenste Fall ist. Ein Tauschkreis bietet ein unvorstellbares Spektrum an Möglichkeiten. Es können Dienstleistungen, Waren, Lebensmittel, Tiere, Pflanzen, Bücher und vieles mehr getauscht werden. Der Tausch erfolgt über „Krems-Taler“. Erwirtschaftete Krems-Taler müssen nicht beim selben Tauschpartner eingelöst werden, was auch der seltenste Fall ist. Ein Tauschkreis bietet ein unvorstellbares Spektrum an Möglichkeiten. Es können Dienstleistungen, Waren, Lebensmittel, Tiere, Pflanzen, Bücher und vieles mehr getauscht werden. Der Tausch erfolgt über „Krems-Taler“. Erwirtschaftete Krems-Taler müssen nicht beim selben Tauschpartner eingelöst werden, was auch der seltenste Fall ist. Die Teilnehmer des Talente-Tauschkreises treffen sich jeden Monat am 2. Freitag im Wintergarten des Café Kemetmüller direkt am Marktplatz in Neuhofen an der Krems. Treffen ab 19 Uhr. Informiere dich, sei dabei!

properties.name: Kultur-Garten-Gemeinschaft Wels
properties.description: Bei der Kultur-Garten-Gemeinschaft soll im Stadtbereich von Wels ein Ort der Begegnung geschaffen werden. An diesem Ort wird ein gemeinsam gestalteter Garten entstehen. Der Garten wird zum gemeinsamen Gemüse-, Kräuter- sowie Obstanbau nach biologischen und permakulturellen Gesichtspunkten für alle Beteiligten zur Verfügung stehen. Interessierte Mitmenschen aus Wels sollen in der Stadt die Möglichkeit bekommen, miteinander eigenes qualitativ hochwertiges Gemüse in nachhaltiger Weise zu kultivieren.

properties.name: Tiroler Edles
properties.description: Im Tiroler Edles gibt esProdukte, die verbraucht oder gebraucht werden, beste Qualität haben, schön sind, hinter denen eine Philosophie, eine Geschichte und Menschen mit besonderen Begabungen stecken und die einen starken Tirol-Bezug haben.

properties.name: Bauernmarkt Wiltener Platzl
properties.description: Jeden Samstag vormittag bieten unsere Bauern der Region Obst, Gemüse, Käse, Wurst, Fleisch, Speck, Fisch, Brot, Eier, Honig, Milch, Blumen und vieles mehr aus eigenem Anbau und Erzeugung an.

properties.name: Markthalle Innsbruck
properties.description:
Uns bewegt der Wunsch nach Dialog und Begegnung,
begleitet von hochwertigen Lebensmitteln und Genussgütern.

properties.name: Sparkassenplatz - Marktlü cke
properties.description: Jeden Freitag von 9 bis 14 Uhr – außer in einer kurzen Winterpause von Weihnachten bis Ende Jänner – verkaufen Bauern und regionale Kleinhersteller ihre Köstlichkeiten am Sparkassenplatz. Frische, saisonal typische bäuerliche Qualitätsprodukte aus Tirol stehen im Mittelpunkt.

properties.name: Asociația Caritas
properties.description: Caritas Câmpulung Association” is a non governmental organisation, functioning under the guardianship of the Catholic Church. The aim of this association is to live the love of God by caring for our neighbours who find themselves in  difficult situations. . Through its projects, the association has been helping 18 year old girls who leave the orphanages illequipped for life.

properties.name: Asociația pentru Ecologie și Turism PRO ECO-TUR - Structura Economică Socială OITUZ
properties.description:ro: SES OITUZ este o structură socială înfiinţată în anul 2015 şi care în decembrie 2016 a fost atestată ca Întreprindere Socială.  Structura a fost înfiinţată de către ASOCIAŢIA PENTRU ECOLOGIE ŞI TURISM PRO ECO-TUR în satul Oituz, comuna Lumina, jud. Constanţa. Activitatea SES OITUZ este bazată pe fabricarea cutiilor de arhivare şi a ambalajelor alimentare şi non-alimentare din hârtie şi carton. Prin înfiinţarea sa, SES OITUZ a creat 6 locuri de muncă în mediul rural, prin angajarea de persoane aparţinând grupurilor vulnerabile (persoane cu dizabilităţi, abuzate, de etnie rromă, provenite din familii numeroase monoparentale, femei cap de familie, fără venituri).
properties.description:
SES OITUZ is a social structure founded in 2015 and was certified in December 2016 as a social enterprise. 
The structure was established by the Association for Ecology and Tourism PRO ECO-TUR in Oituz village, township Lumina, jud. Constanta. 
SES OITUZ activity is based on manufacturing the archiving boxes and food and non-food packaging, paper and cardboard.
The establishment of SES OITUZ created six jobs in rural areas by hiring persons belonging to vulnerable groups (disabled, abused, Roma, many from single-parent families, women heads of households without income).

properties.name: Fundatia Ajutati Copiii
properties.description:
The social enterprise of the "Help the Children Romania" Foundation is a social economy structure, officially certified by the social enterprise no. 0008 / 27.06.2017, in accordance with the Law 219/2015 on the social economy.
It offers its customers clothes washing services, cleaning and greening services at affordable prices, and promoting the social impact that they create by buying the services of the social enterprise.

properties.name: Mesteshukar ButiQ Cluj
properties.description: Meşteshukar ButiQ Cluj brings in the heart of the city the traditional Roma crafts, crafted by skillful hands in a creative format, a mobile shop which challenges you to follow it around the city and country.
properties.description:ro: Meșteshukar ButiQ Cluj aduce în inima orașului meșteșuguri cu tradiție romă, lucrate de mâini iscusite într-un format creativ, un magazin mobil care te provoacă să-l urmărești prin oraș și prin țară.

properties.name: Concordia
properties.description: CONCORDIA bakery, social economy enterprise part of CONCORDIA Development, economic branch of CONCORDIA Humanitarian Organization, supports young people in difficulty to follow the Baker courses organized by the School of Crafts.
properties.free_keywords: Concordia bakery;Concordia social enterprise;natural bakery products
properties.description:ro: Brutăria CONCORDIA, întreprindere de economie socială care face parte din CONCORDIA Development, ramură economică a Organizației Umanitare CONCORDIA, susține tineri aflați în dificultate să urmeze cursurile de brutar organizate de Școala de Meserii.

properties.name: Roțile Schimbării
properties.description: Roțile schimbării is running services supporting people with disabilities as main activity: wheelchair adapted transport services. The unit is also registred as a protected unit.
properties.description:ro: Roțile Schimbării are ca obiect de activitate derularea de servicii în sprijinul persoanelor cu dizabilități: transport adaptat și servicii scaune rulante. Deține totodată Autorizație de Unitate Protejată

properties.name: EcoStyle Construct
properties.description: Style Eco Construct installed a dedicated hall for nature friendly constructions. The association offers local craftsmen a way to use their skills and creates jobs in an area where only waves of tourists can bring wealth.
properties.description:ro: Eco Style Construct a instalat o hală dedicată construcțiilor apropiate de natura. Asociația oferă meșterilor locali o modalitate de a-și folosi îndemânarea și creează locuri de muncă într-o zonă în care doar valurile de turiști mai pot aduce bunăstare.

properties.name: Util Deco
properties.description: Util Deco is a protected unit, which has 36 people with disabilities employed. The unit is providing services of archiving and storing documents; Tailoring and personalization; Printing and bookbinding; products and services brokerage.
properties.description:ro: Util Deco este o unitate protejată, ce are angajate 36 persoane cu dizabilități și prestează servicii de Arhivare și depozitare documente; Croitorie și personalizare; Tipografie și legătorie; Intermediere de produse și servicii.

properties.name: EffectIO
properties.description: EffectIO mission is to help young IT enthusiasts to better define their chosen career direction and propel them towards prestigious companies in the industry.
properties.description:ro: Misiunea EffectIO este aceea de a-i ajuta tinerii pasionaţi de IT să îşi definească mai bine direcţia în cariera aleasă şi de a-i propulsa pe aceştia către companii de prestigiu din industrie.

properties.name: Atelierul de pânză
properties.description:ro: În “Atelierul de Pânză” se confecționează sacoșe din bumbac 100% natural  și alte obiecte din materiale textile reutilizate (penare, portfarduri, huse laptop). Majoritatea angajaților sunt persoane cu dizabilități și din grupuri vulnerabile.
properties.description: Atelierul de Pânză uses 100% natural cotton and reused textile materials  to manufacture textile bags and other objects (pencil boxes, beauty bags, laptop cases). Most employees are people with disabilities and come from vulnerable groups.

properties.name: Shukar Event
properties.description: Sukar Event offers event planning services and ethnic tourism in Roma communities from Calarasi County and beyond.
properties.description:ro: Sukar Event oferă servicii de organizare de evenimente și turism etnic în comunitățile de romi din județul Călărași și nu numai.

properties.name: Util Deco
properties.description: Util Deco is a protected unit, which has 36 people with disabilities employed. The unit is providing services of archiving and storing documents; Tailoring and personalization; Printing and bookbinding; products and services brokerage.
properties.description:ro: Util Deco este o unitate protejată, ce are angajate 36 persoane cu dizabilități și prestează servicii de Arhivare și depozitare documente; Croitorie și personalizare; Tipografie și legătorie; Intermediere de produse și servicii.

properties.name: Atelierul de design  RBQ
properties.description:ro: Atelierul de Design valorizează produsele meşteşugarilor romi. Având ca furnizori meşteşugari şi cooperative din țară, atelierul lucrează cu designeri internaționali pentru dezvoltarea unei linii de produse contemporane realizate prin tehnici străvechi.
properties.description: Atelierul de Design harness Roma craftsmen products. With a network of suppliers as craftsmen and cooperatives across the country, the studio works with international designers to develop a line of contemporary products made by ancient techniques.

properties.name: Caravana Mesteshukarilor
properties.description: Caravana Meșteshukarilor aims to combine modalities of social economy with old Roma craft traditions and contemporary creativity in product design and fashion.
properties.description:ro: Caravana Meșteshukarilor urmărește să îmbine modalitățile de funcționare ale economiei sociale cu vechile tradiții meșteșugărești rome și creativitatea contemporană în materie de design de produs și vestimentar.

properties.name: Recicleta
properties.description:ro: Recicleta colectează hârtie, PET și doze de aluminiu pentru reciclare. Transport asigurat cu cargo-triciclete, conduse de persoane din grupuri vulnerabile. Colectare de la firme și cladiri din nordul, centrul și estul Bucureștiului.
properties.description: Recicleta collects paper, PET and aluminum cans for recycling. Transported with cargo-tricycles, headed by persons from vulnerable groups. They collect from businesses and buildings in the north, center and east of Bucharest.

properties.name: Zig Zag
properties.description: Zigzag is a textile workshop which produces textiles with quality materials at fair prices. Collections of bedding, decorative pillows, bags and scarves are just some of the products launched.
properties.description:ro: Zig-Zag este un atelier de confecţii textile din care produce confecții textile din materiale de calitate la prețuri corecte. Colecțiile de așternuturi, perne decorative, genți și eșarfe sunt doar câteva din produsele deja lansate.

properties.name: Social Gym
properties.description: Social club Gym is the first nonprofit fitness and aerobic Club that offers diversified aerobics, wellness and nutrition services and promotes responsible behavior action programs, social and networking events.
properties.description:ro: Social Gym este primul club non-profit de fitness și aerobic ce oferă servicii diversificate de fitness, aerobic, wellness și nutriție și promovează un comportament responsabil prin programe de acțiune socială și evenimente de networking.

properties.name: Mestesukar Fashion
properties.description: Mesteshukar Fashion is a textile workshop part of Mesteshukar ButiQ network that produces clothing items in collaboration with Austrian designers.
properties.description:ro: Mestesukar Fashion este un atelier de confecţii textile din rețeaua Mesteshukar ButiQ care produce obiecte de îmbrăcăminte în colaborare cu designeri austrieci.

properties.name: Mesteshukar ButiQ
properties.description: Meşteshukar ButiQ (MBQ) is a network of social enterprises supporting traditional Roma crafts. The store highlights products created by artisans and designers from silver, copper, wood, wicker and textiles.
properties.description:ro: Meşteshukar ButiQ (MBQ) este o rețea de întreprinderi sociale care susține meșteșugurile tradiționale ale romilor. Magazinul evidențiază produsele create de meșteșugari și designeri din argint, cupru, lemn, răchită și textile.

properties.name: Util Deco
properties.description: Util Deco is a protected unit, which has 36 people with disabilities employed. The unit is providing services of archiving and storing documents; Tailoring and personalization; Printing and bookbinding; products and services brokerage.
properties.description:ro: Util Deco este o unitate protejată, ce are angajate 36 persoane cu dizabilități și prestează servicii de Arhivare și depozitare documente; Croitorie și personalizare; Tipografie și legătorie; Intermediere de produse și servicii.

properties.name: Pe Intuneric
properties.description:ro: Pe Întuneric este un muzeu restaurant care te invită într-o călătorie în care vei fi privat de vedere, dar vei avea parte de o serie întreagă de experinţe senzoriale unice, cu ajutorul altor simţuri: auzul, mirosul, tactilul şi gustul
properties.description: Pe Întuneric is a museum-restaurant that invites you to go through a journey in which you will be deprived of the vision sense but you will have a range of unique sensorial experiences by using other senses: hearing, smell, tactile and taste

properties.name: S.O.S.
properties.description: SOS is an authorized workshop for processing archives, bindery and document warehouse established by the Humanitarian Association Together for Them Baia Mare
properties.description:ro: Atelier autorizat de prelucrare arhivistica, legatorie si depozit pentru documente înființat de Asociația Umanitară Împreună pentru Ei Baia Mare

properties.name: Restaurant Zaiafet
properties.description:ro: Zaiafet oferă servicii de catering, cu feluri de mâncare variate și gustoase, inspirate din cultura culinară romani. Influențele pot fi­ sesizate în modul de preparare (preparate la ceaun, fripturi gătite bine), cât si în ingredientele speci­fice.
properties.description: Zaiafet offers catering services with varied and tasty dishes inspired by the culinary culture of the Roma people. Influences can be determined in the way of cooking ( cauldron cooked dishes, well-cooked steaks), and in the specific ingredients.

properties.name: 1ForAll
properties.description:ro: 1ForAll oferă o gamă variată de produse personalizabile: îmbrăcăminte; articole utile pentru casă; articole de călătorie; produse adresate industriei HoReCa; echipamente de protecţie a muncii; accesorii IT&C; accesorii de birou; instrumente de scris timp liber şi relaxare; artizanat.
properties.description: 1ForAll ofers a varied gama of customizable products: clothing, accesories, house tools, traveling tools, products designated for the HoReCa industry, protection equipment, IT&C accesories, desk accesories, writing instruments, artisan products.

properties.name: Mama Pan
properties.description:ro: La Brutaria MamaPan facem paine si produse de patiserie artizanale sanatoase, crescute cu maia, fara drojdie comerciala. In realizarea produselor MamaPan nu folosim niciun fel de adaosuri chimice, ci doar apa, sare, seminte si faina neaditivata, fara amelioratori sau conservanti. MamaPan este o brutarie la care lucreaza mame cu multi copii sau care isi cresc singure copiii si care astfel au gasit un loc de munca.
properties.description: At MamaPan bakery we make bread and other healthy products, based on maia, without commercial yeast. In the making of our products we dont use any kind of chemicals, but only water, salt, seeds and natural flour. At MamaPan, single mothers who raise children on their own found a good workplace.

properties.name: Asociatia Touched Collection
properties.description: Touched Collection is a non profit association that offers activities helping in the creative, psychological and emotional development of children, adults, mothers at risk, single mothers, abused women, homeless and jobless mothers.

properties.name: Washaway – Curatatoria profesionala de la usa ta
properties.description:ro: Oferirea unor servicii profesionale de spalatorie textile, in care nu pretul ci calitatea sa fie pe primul loc, prin implicarea in activitatea structurii de economie sociala a grupurilor vulnerabile.
properties.description: We offer quality texture washing, handled by groups at risk.

properties.name: Atelier Simpluș
properties.description:ro: Mic atelier de jucarii din textile care isi doreste ca prin activitatea sa sa ajute grupurile defavorizate din cadrul comunitatii
properties.description: Small workshop that works with groups at risk to produce textile toys.

properties.name: Outdoor Woodland Learning School,
properties.description:
Welcome to the Outdoor Woodland Learning School CIC (not for profit) where you can access outdoor learning opportunities in an enjoyable and inspiring environment with qualified session leaders.

We provide forest school activities for individual members of the public, families, nurseries, schools and groups. Single sessions are available for birthday parties, afterschool clubs and organised groups.

properties.name: The Fairtrade Foundation
properties.description:
Fairtrade is a simple way to make a difference to the lives of the people who grow the things we love. We do this by changing the way trade works through better prices, decent working conditions and a fair deal for farmers and workers in developing countries. 

Our mission is to connect disadvantaged producers and consumers, promote fairer trading conditions and empower producers to combat poverty, strengthen their position and take more control over their lives.

properties.name: Growhampton
properties.description: Growhampton is a sustainability programme with a big focus on food. It is delivered by Roehampton Students' Union at the University of Roehampton. It was established in September 2013 with funding from the NUS Students’ Green Fund.

properties.name: School for Social Entrepreneurs
properties.description:
We believe everybody has the capacity to be remarkable. We empower people to create change in their communities and improve the lives of others.
We support social entrepreneurs: people who tackle social problems by starting, scaling and sustaining organisations. We help them impact urgent issues, such as poverty, health, education and the environment.
We help more than 1,000 leaders of social change every year through courses, connections and support. We develop their impact, networks, business skills and emotional resourcefulness. Our learning approach focuses on peer-support and taking action. We’re about sharing experiences rather than writing essays. We welcome people from all backgrounds and our community blossoms with diverse connections.
Michael Young founded School for Social Entrepreneurs in 1997 in London. Today, our network of 11 schools impacts communities across the UK, Canada and India. We support individuals on a learning journey, creating social change together.

properties.name: Luminary Bakery
properties.description: LUMINARY GREW OUT OF KAHAILA AS AN INNOVATIVE RESPONSE TO A NEED WE SAW FOR WOMEN WHO HAVE HAD A SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DISADVANTAGE. WE ARE A SOCIAL ENTERPRISE DESIGNED TO OFFER OPPORTUNITIES FOR WOMEN TO BUILD A FUTURE FOR THEMSELVES. WE PROVIDE A SAFE AND PROFESSIONAL ENVIRONMENT WHERE WOMEN CAN GROW HOLISTICALLY – ENCOURAGING AMBITION, RESTORATION AND SECOND CHANCES. WE USE BAKING AS A TOOL TO TAKE WOMEN ON A JOURNEY TO EMPLOYABILITY AND ENTREPRENEURSHIP, EQUIPPING THEM WITH TRANSFERRABLE SKILLS FOR THE WORKING WORLD. WE OFFER COURSES, WORK EXPERIENCE AND PAID EMPLOYMENT WITHIN OUR BAKERY, EMPOWERING WOMEN TO BUILD THEIR CAREER. BY INVESTING IN AND RELEASING THEM TO REALISE THEIR DREAMS, THROUGH TRAINING, EMPLOYMENT AND COMMUNITY, WE AIM TO BREAK THE GENERATIONAL CYCLES OF ABUSE, PROSTITUTION, CRIMINAL ACTIVITY AND POVERTY.

properties.name: Bootstrap Company
properties.type_of_initiative: other; networking_initiative; entrepreneurship_education; business_incubators; socialinclusion_employment; coworking
properties.description: Provides affordable office space to new local enterprises, creates jobs for local youth and has events to bring community together.

properties.description: Co-operative selling wholefoods

properties.name: Sophia Hub
properties.description: Social enterprise supporting local people to create their own businesses and connect with others

properties.name: Brixton Cycles Co-op
properties.description: Co-operative bike shop and repair shop that has been around for over 30 years, providing support to local people

properties.name: Better Health Bakery
properties.description: artisan bakery and a social enterprise based in Haggerston, London, producing handcrafted traditional sourdough breads and providing trainee placements to people recovering from mental ill health.

properties.name: Edu-Care Recycling UK
properties.description: Community interest company committed to recycling equipment and furniture, help unemployed people with jobs and volunteering opportunities

properties.name: Coin Street Community Builders
properties.description: Social enterprise supporting local neighbourhood through co-operatives

properties.type_of_initiative: other; networking_initiative; entrepreneurship_education; business_incubators; socialinclusion_employment; coworking
properties.description: Co-operative and social enterprise support local enterprises and communities

properties.name: White Rock Trust
properties.description: White Rock Trust now works to care for and improve the whole neighbourhood. The Trust is led by and for the benefit of local residents, businesses and other White Rock champions.

properties.name: Zaytoun
properties.description: Community-interest company supporting fair trade in Palestine, by creating a market in the UK for consumers

properties.name: People Tree
properties.description: Online fairtrade and ethical fashion

properties.name: Cultivate
properties.description: Co-operative owned and funded by the community- grow own vegetables and create a local food system in Oxford

properties.name: Project Motor House
properties.description: Transformative project turning an old building into a community asset with support of local people

properties.name: Wessex Social Ventures (WSV)
properties.description: At Wessex Social Ventures (WSV) we help build ideas and projects into sustainable social businesses.We currently run three enterprises, aimed at communities living on less than $3 per day. WSV provide the business models, the resources and the training. In other words, we focus on giving people the tools they need to help themselves. We aim to create true empowerment by providing long term fulfilling jobs, powering the local economy and solving some of the world's fundamental social issues. We bring together expertise from social organisations, corporates, the public sector and an experienced advisory team, to form a network committed to using their skills to accelerate social businesses.

properties.name: BluPoint
properties.description:
BluPoint provide Free Access to curated content to areas without internet. Empowering the technology that people already have in their pockets.
Our mission: Improving the lives of 20M people in 20,000 communities by 2020.

properties.name: Inkpact
properties.description: Handwritten communication can be the difference between being deleted or forgettable, and being remembered and talked about. Nothing makes an impact like a handwritten letter. We’re a registered social enterprise, which means we work with charities to support people in difficult circumstances improve their employability and literacy. Inkpact provides flexible working for those who cannot commit to full-time or a traditional, 9-5, office-based work pattern. As one of our writers, individuals supplement their income by picking up as little or as much work as their commitments allow, with the flexibility to alter their workload as needed and work whenever it fits into their schedule. By providing truly flexible work that can be completed from any location, Inkpact has the potential to create opportunities for thousands and have a positive impact on reducing unemployment and underemployment rates in the UK.

properties.name: Star & Crescent
properties.description: Star & Crescent is an independent news website that believes in journalism to create social change.

properties.name: Social Enterprise Link
properties.description:
Social Enterprise Link: Creating and providing opportunies for social, cooperative, community and trading charity enterprises
Social Enterprise Link (wessex) CIC is opening up opportunities for social enterprises and liaising with the private, public and non-trading charity sectors, to facilitate the creation of a strong local Social Economy Enterprise Sector. Our mission is to help create and then maintain a sector that commands 25% of the local economy by 2035 in Wessex.

properties.name: Crowd Leaf
properties.description: We are a forum and blog. Our aim is to bring up-to-date news on innovation and disruptive technology covering all things green and sustainable. Together we can share the news and breakthroughs from all over the world, in all markets and we can bring together knowledge and passions that will hopefully make more advancements possible.

properties.name: Community Empowerment Ltd
properties.description:
We bring together individuals and groups wanting to place power into communities. We deliver the training for people to take control of their future  and that of their communities.

We provide alternative solutions for welfare-to-work, helping people to improve their employability. We work WITH jobseekers to create employment.

properties.name: Rowner Community Trust
properties.description:
Rowner Community Trust works with local people to establish a strong active community making Grange Ward the place to live.

The Trust is owned by local people and works in the Grange Ward area to:  

Continually improve the environment
Expand the local services from the Nimrod and Youth Arts Media Centre
Enable the community to deliver social activities
Grow economic opportunities

properties.name: South Parade Trust
properties.description: A voluntary organisation dedicated to ensure South Parade Pier, Southsea will be structurally sound, safe and welcoming for future generations.

properties.name: The Good Mental Health Cooperative
properties.description:
Our vision is to contribute to a society which values our mental and emotional health, just as we do our physical health.

We aim to challenge stigma and exclusion, and make the best possible use of community potential to educate, support and promote good mental health.

properties.name: Entrepreneurs Unite
properties.description:
Entrepreneurs Unite is a not-for-profit organisation providing events, information and more to South of England entrepreneurs. We function as a social enterprise and all our events and services are free.

We work with groups and individuals from business, education and the public sector to support entrepreneurial success.

Entrepreneurs seeking finance can learn about finance options, prepare for investment and practice pitching at our events. Invest South is the sister company to Entrepreneurs Unite and operates as a private company, charging commission but no upfront fees. Invest South works with entrepreneurs on an individual basis to secure grants or investment from private individuals. No fees are payable until funds are secured.

Entrepreneurs Unite – Supporting Entrepreneurial Success.

properties.name: Social Enterprise UK
properties.description: With an ever-expanding membership of well over a thousand – we’re the largest social enterprise network in the UK. From building markets for social enterprises to large scale public facing campaigns such as Social Saturday, we exist to amplify the voice of our members and get social enterprise on the radars of decision makers across sectors. As well as operating nationally we have a strong regional presence in communities through our Social Enterprise Places Programme.

properties.name: Locality
properties.description:
Locality is the national network of ambitious and enterprising community-led organisations, working together to help neighbourhoods thrive.

All our work aims to inspire local communities to change and improve.

We help people to set up locally owned and led organisations
We support organisations to exchange ideas and best practice on community asset ownership, community enterprise and social action
We work to influence government and others at national and local level to build support and investment for the movement
We run major national programmes to support and empower local communities
We aim to support community anchor organisations, like our members, and help them grow and thrive.

properties.name: The Platform
properties.description:
As the home of the Brighton and Hove Social Enterprise Network (BHSEN), The Platform supports the social economy to thrive through a range of tailored support, events, resources, networking, training, showcases and representation.

The Platform is a social enterprise supporting people to achieve their potential through learning, skills, social business and social enterprise development.

properties.name: The Fair Shop
properties.description:
FAIR is one of the only shops in the country to specialise in Fair Trade and ethical fashion.

Located in the city of Brighton and Hove, we opened our doors in 2008 to offer the residents of our city beautiful, fair trade products from around the world. We are located at fashion landmark 21 Queen’s Road which was home to Brighton Biba in the 1960s.

At FAIR we stock a range of different brands whose ethical credentials are second to none, not only in their support for Fair Trade production but increasingly through the use of organic and sustainable fabrics. We have a fabulous range of womenswear and a developing selection of menswear as well as products for your home.

properties.name: The Big Fig
properties.description:
The Big Fig is a catering company creating delicious food using fresh, locally sourced ingredients. We offer exciting menus for events, parties and business meetings. From our freshly baked focaccia bread, to our Sussex wood pigeon carpaccio topped with maderia jelly, to our delectable brownies, we ensure that we provide something special for every occasion.

And even better – The Big Fig is a social enterprise. We use our profits to support unemployed and disadvantaged people to gain skills and qualifications to build a future career in catering.

properties.name: Loughmore Cottage Shop and Tearooms
properties.description: Shop and tearoom specialising in locally produced and handcrafted items

properties.name: Cill Barra Community Sports Centre
properties.description: Promotes collective economic activity that is community owned and is a resource for the health and fitness needs of our community.

properties.name: Grow It Yourself Ireland
properties.description: An emerging global network of people who grow some of their own food.

properties.name: Dunhill EcoPark
properties.description: An integrated set of innovative projects including enterprise, environment, heritage and social projects.

properties.name: Waterford Suir Valley Railway
properties.description: Experience the beauty of the River Suir on a period carraige.

properties.name: Wildways Adventures
properties.description: Runs educational programmes that focus on sustainability, energy, etc. as well as runs outdoor programmes for groups and families.

properties.name: Ballybeg Greens
properties.description: Ballybeg Greens is committed to the development of a sustainable business model by providing training and employment opportunities and to provide high-quality produce to local restaurants.

properties.name: Mpower Community Consultants
properties.description: Carries out research, community consultancy, evaluation and support work for the community and voluntary sector.

properties.name: Better Health Bakery
properties.description: Better Health Bakery is an artisan bakery based in Haggerston, East London. We are part of Hackney mental health charity, the Centre for Better Health. As a social enterprise we provide trainee placements to adults recovering from mental ill health.

properties.name: The Centre for Better Health
properties.description:
The Centre for Better Health is a community-based charity that supports well-being and recovery from mental ill-health.
Our Vision
We recognise a healthy community is an inclusive community in which individuals can live satisfying and hopeful lives and where there is no stigma about mental ill health.

Our Mission
To support wellbeing and recovery from mental ill-health.

Our Aims
To build skills, confidence and improve wellbeing
To encourage social engagement and participation
To make meaning of experiences, facilitate growth and progress towards goals.

properties.name: Better Health Bikes
properties.description: We are a bicycle workshop and social enterprise located at 13 Stean Street, Haggerston, London. The workshop offers affordable bike servicing from Cytech Trained mechanics,  puncture repairs, along with free bike health checks and free simple bike fittings, while offering trainee placements to those recovering from mental ill-health.

properties.name: Better Health Products
properties.description:
Part of The Centre for Better Health, Better Health Products Ltd was initially set up as a sheltered workshop in April 1972, with the aim of providing structured activity for its members and supporting the development of skills for individuals who experienced severe and enduring mental health problems.

Today Better Health Products Ltd is a Social Enterprise largely run by volunteers who are former service users. It offers work placements of up to one year consisting of on the job training, peer-to-peer training, team work and social support, as well as informal and possibilities of accredited learning. The aim is for individuals to gain confidence, develop of new skills and move closer to the labour market; moving on to training and education, volunteer roles or open employment.

Trainee Placements in Better Health Products Ltd

Better Health Products Ltd is a leading provider of Platilon products to the healthcare industry. These products include protection covers, immobilisation & positioning cushions and vacuum casting bags.

This area offers technical skills to be develop through training in the manufacturing of Platilon products. Most of the training will be on the job training include processing orders, manufacturing and dispatching and stock control. Theoretical training will also include quality standards, health and safety and stock control. We train our service users in all areas of the business while maintaining high quality standards according the ISO 9001.
Better Health Products Ltd is a leading supplier of Platilon®U manufactured by Epurex Films , a subsidiary of Bayer Material Science AG.

Platilon®U is a thermoplastic film based on polyurethane (TPU film). It is the TPU film of choice in high performance industries with critical manufacturing processes because of its outstanding properties and durability.

The uses for Platilon®U extend from medical applications as components in special seating and prosthetics through the construction and automotive industries to footwear and clothing manufacture in the leisure and sports industries.

Better Health Products Ltd is a social enterprise, established in 1972. It is part of The Centre for Better Health, a community based mental health charity supporting people through their recovery.

properties.name: Resurgo Trust
properties.description:
Resurgo means to rise up again. It describes our belief in the unbelievable difference we can all make in the world around us when we work together. By connecting our creativity, talents and resources we can move mountains to create a greater society together.

Resurgo’s initiatives are Spear, an award-winning programme helping young unemployed people into work or education, and Resurgo Ventures, supporting  emerging social entrepreneurs to make a positive impact on society.

Social change is too important to leave to politicians or experts alone – it is something we all have a stake in and each of us has a crucial part to play. Only by working together can we achieve the social and cultural goals we hold in common.

Resurgo connects people regardless of background around this shared vision. We work with local residents, social entrepreneurs, businesses, artists, volunteers and many others. As a registered charity based out of local churches, our work is fully inclusive and open to all, so that together we can create a more inspiring society and a stronger legacy for future generations to enjoy.

properties.name: Bedford Creative Arts
properties.description: WE COMMISSION ART THAT DIRECTLY ENGAGES THE PUBLIC THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH ARTISTS. We are a charity funded by Arts Council England, Trusts and Foundations and your support.

properties.name: Integrated Education Fund
properties.description:
Providing the opportunity for the children of NI to be educated together, not apart.

We believe that educating all children together is an essential part of the reconciliation process and of building a society that celebrates respect, understanding and friendships across traditional divides.

properties.name: Keep Northern Ireland Beautiful
properties.description: Keep Northern Ireland Beautiful is an independent charity dedicated to creating a cleaner, greener and more sustainable Northern Ireland by delivering on improving environmental education in every school in Northern Ireland, increasing public engagement for communities in need and raising environmental standards for the places where people spend time: where they live, work and relax.

properties.name: Centre for Global Education
properties.description: Centre for Global Education believes in and works toward a just and equitable world. It uses education to tackle poverty and inequality locally and globally.

properties.name: Eco-Schools Northern Ireland
properties.description:
Our aim is to support schools to combine learning and action leading to the improved environmental performance of schools in NI.
Promoting sustainable living through whole-school action supported by learning resources, management tools and the internationally recognised Green Flag award scheme.

properties.name: Fair Trade Wales
properties.description: Fair Trade Wales is the national organisation for Fair Trade education, policy, procurement, support and campaigning in Wales; the world’s first Fair Trade Nation.

properties.name: Sussed
properties.description:
SUSSED is an Ethical & Fairtrade Store in Wales. Fair - Local -Eco-chic. 
By promoting the sale of only the best organic, biodegradable, recycled, or otherwise eco-friendly goods, we can safeguard the environment without compromising on quality. 

Strengthening our local economy will keep money circulating locally maintaining a diverse and unique range of shops and activities for us all to enjoy.

properties.name: RISING Global Peace Forum
properties.description:
RISING Global Peace Forum is based in the iconic city of Coventry in the UK, global City of Peace and Reconciliation and UK City of Culture 2021.

Led by the Centre for Trust, Peace and Social Relations at Coventry University, RISING Global Peace Forum started as a unique partnership with Coventry Cathedral and Coventry City Council.

properties.name: Groundwork London
properties.description:
Groundwork London helps communities across the capital become greener, stronger and healthier.
We work with people living in London’s most vulnerable places to transform open space, re-connect people with nature, provide training & create jobs, and reduce energy use & waste.
Our three main areas of work are:
- Creating better places
- Improving people's prospects
- Greener living & working
Our vision is of a society of sustainable communities which are vibrant, healthy and safe; which respect the local and global environment, and where individuals and enterprise prosper.
As a fast growing city, London faces a number of complex challenges: a rapidly increasing population, rising inequality, political uncertainty and the effects of climate change. 
When these are combined with continued reductions in public funding, it is often the communities most in need that are worst affected. 
Our projects and programmes help build the capacity of these communities, empowering them to engage in and shape the future of their local area. 
We support Londoners to find sustainable, long-term solutions to the challenges they face, resulting in a healthier, more resilient city, where everyone has the opportunity to prosper.
Groundwork London is committed to protecting, and bringing about sustainable improvements to, the local environment.

properties.name: Groundwork
properties.description:
We're passionate about creating a future where everywhere is vibrant and green, every community is strong and able to shape its own destiny and where everyone can reach their potential.
The community charity with a green heart.
Groundwork began as a simple idea: if communities help the environment, the environment will help communities.
This is still our approach today. By bringing people and the environment together with practical local action, we have an impact that is greater than the sum of its parts.
Every year we help communities through thousands of these projects across the UK. 
Projects that include:
Tackling climate change by helping people out of fuel poverty,
Bringing out the best in young people by helping them to improve their local area,
Building stronger communities by improving parks, playgrounds and other shared green spaces,
Getting people back into work by creating green jobs
and many more.
WHAT WE DO
The most effective and lasting solutions are usually created at the local level in partnership with local people and organisations. This means that the mix of activities we carry out will vary from place to place to meet the specific needs of that community.

More often than not this activity will focus on one or more of our three main areas of work:
- Creating better, greener places -
 Improving people's prospects -
 Promoting greener living and working.

properties.name: Malt Cross
properties.description:
The Malt Cross Trust was founded as a Christian charity by a consortium of city centre churches who had a vision of improving Nottingham’s Night Life by:
•	Offering an alternative Night out (Malt Cross Bar & Kitchen)
•	Providing Hands on Help (Street Pastors Project)
Our charity’s home is a Grade II listed former Victorian music hall which we preserve as one of the last remaining music halls in the country and we still provide live music and entertainment for the people of Nottingham today.  
 Our Bar & Kitchen is a non-for-profit and donates all its operational surplus back into the work of the Malt Cross Trust. 
It also engages with improving our city through a Suspended Meal Scheme (where our customers can pay it forward to someone in need), the use of our gallery and workshop spaces as an arts hub and our heritage tours and events that share the story of the Malt Cross Music Hall.

properties.name: Groundwork East
properties.description:
Groundwork is the community charity with a green heart.
We want places to look better, streets to be safer and outside areas to be green and beautiful. We want people of all ages to be able to do things together to make the best of where they live. We want to improve job prospects by offering training. We want to show people how they can make their homes more efficient places to run and support businesses with their corporate social responsibility. 

We work towards a vision of a society of sustainable communities which are vibrant, healthy and safe, which respect the local and global environment and where individuals and enterprise prosper. Creating these sustainable communities means developing initiatives which cut across economic, social and environmental issues.  Our work is diverse, but it all helps to achieve our vision.

We focus on three major areas of activity:  
 
Creating better places
Encouraging greener living and working
Improving people's prospects

properties.name: Groundwork Greater Nottingham
properties.description:
Changing places, changing lives - one green step at a time
Big global issues – the economy, the environment – have a big local impact. We work across the UK helping communities find practical solutions to the challenges they face.

The Groundwork Greater Nottingham Trust
We are a community charity with a green heart.

People lie at the heart of what we do. We work towards a vision of an environment in which people and their communities flourish.

We will achieve our vision by; engaging, understanding, responding and enabling individuals and their communities.

properties.name: Garden Organic
properties.description:
Our charity brings together thousands of people who share a common belief - that organic growing is essential for a healthy and sustainable world.

Through campaigning, advice, community work and research, our aim is to get everyone growing ‘the organic way’.

Garden Organic, the working name of the Henry Doubleday Research Association, is a registered charity in England and Wales.

properties.name: Groundwork Northamptonshire
properties.description: Focusing on new and existing urban environments, we work with local people and our local partners to create better places to live and work.  The vast majority of our projects depend upon the support and expertise of others; our approach is always to build partnerships based on common ambition.  We do not duplicate the work of any existing organisations; we collaborate and co-ordinate to achieve what local people ask us to do.

properties.name: Groundwork South
properties.description:
Changing places, changing lives - one green step at a time
Big global issues – the economy, the environment – have a big local impact. We work across the UK helping communities find practical solutions to the challenges they face.

Groundwork South
We've been working for more than 30 years where we’re needed most – on the ground in communities across the South of England, delivering hundreds of projects every year.

properties.name: Five Acre Community Farm
properties.opening_hours: 10am- 1pm Tuesday and Saturday, otherwise by appointment
properties.description:
We are an organic vegetable farm founded in early 2012. We are based at Garden Organic in Ryton, between Coventry and Rugby.
We are a Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) Scheme and we are also a community and have regular social events

properties.name: Challenges Worldwide
properties.description:
Company growth creates jobs and a secure income for people living in town and cities.  This also helps rural farmers who depend upon urban businesses to process, package and sell their goods.  Earning your own money is the first step towards reducing the need for charity or aid and helps communities to develop a stable way to support themselves.

Since 1999 we have worked in over 40 countries across the world supporting people and enterprises to work together to help their community have better access to goods, services and money.

Since 2014 we have been focusing our work on Sub-Saharan Africa. With funding from the UK Government, we are working with young people and small to medium sized enterprises (SMEs) across Ghana, Uganda, Rwanda and Zambia to help people learn the skills that are needed to improve and grow local businesses and create sustainable economies that promote prosperity for all.

properties.name: PECT 25
properties.description:
Creating Sustainable Places -
We work to protect and enhance the environment – making a difference now and for the future.
An environmental charity that aims to make places better for people and the planet.
We promote sustainable practices to help protect our environment now and to leave a legacy for future generations. Positive change to create greener, happier, healthier places is at the heart of what we do. We deliver innovative projects of local, regional and national significance, enabling change for a smarter future.

properties.name: Bioregional
properties.description:
Bioregional champions a better, more sustainable way to live. We work with partners to create better places for people to live, work and do business.
We want to see thriving regional economies where we meet more of our needs from local, renewable and waste resources, enabling people to live happy, healthy lives within the natural limits of the planet, leaving space for wildlife and wilderness.
We call this One Planet Living.
We want to make a real difference, inspire others to do the same and work with our partners to make innovative projects and lasting change happen.  Bioregional has twenty years of experience of delivering ambitious but practical products and services, which bring a commercial advantage for partners.

properties.name: PECT Brighton
properties.description:
Bioregional champions a better, more sustainable way to live. We work with partners to create better places for people to live, work and do business.


We want to see thriving regional economies where we meet more of our needs from local, renewable and waste resources, enabling people to live happy, healthy lives within the natural limits of the planet, leaving space for wildlife and wilderness.

We call this One Planet Living.

Our approach
We want to make a real difference, inspire others to do the same and work with our partners to make innovative projects and lasting change happen.  Bioregional has twenty years of experience of delivering ambitious but practical products and services, which bring a commercial advantage for partners.

properties.name: PECT Oxford
properties.description:
Bioregional champions a better, more sustainable way to live. We work with partners to create better places for people to live, work and do business.

We want to see thriving regional economies where we meet more of our needs from local, renewable and waste resources, enabling people to live happy, healthy lives within the natural limits of the planet, leaving space for wildlife and wilderness.

We call this One Planet Living.

Our approach
We want to make a real difference, inspire others to do the same and work with our partners to make innovative projects and lasting change happen.  Bioregional has twenty years of experience of delivering ambitious but practical products and services, which bring a commercial advantage for partners.

properties.name: National Community Wood Recycling Project (NCWRP)
properties.description:
The National Community Wood Recycling Project (NCWRP) was founded in 2003 to help set up and develop a nationwide network of wood recycling social enterprises.

Modelled on the multi-award-winning Brighton & Hove Wood Recycling Project (also known as The Wood Store Brighton), the aim of these enterprises is to:

Save resources by rescuing and re-using waste timber that would otherwise be landfilled (or at very best downcycled into woodchip).
Create sustainable jobs, as well as training and volunteering opportunities, for local people – especially those who might find it difficult to get into or back to employment.
Together, the NCWRP and our member enterprises brand ourselves as Community Wood Recycling.

properties.name: Brighthelm Community Centre
properties.description:
Catering, restaurant, pub & cafe, Education and training, Venue and meeting room hire
There is lots happening every day at Brighthelm. The centre provides office space for a number of charities and social enterprises delivering services and support to people in Brighton and Hove and beyond. During the week, Brighthelm Pre-school runs a daily facility for two to five year olds and our café is open to the public providing coffee, cakes, meals and other refreshments. Every day is different, with the centre typically hosting various different meetings and conferences, lunch time exercise classes and evening leisure activities. At the weekend, weddings, theatre and parties are the norm and several churches use the venue on Sundays for a range of different styles of Christian worship.

properties.name: Brighton & Hove Food Partnership
properties.description:
The Brighton & Hove Food Partnership puts food at the heart of all we do. Growing food, cooking and eating are great ways to improve people’s lives.
The Food Partnership was started by local residents in 2003, and we now have over 20 staff delivering a range of projects. We’re a not-for-profit organisation and we work with a wide range of partners including community organisations, statutory agencies, local businesses and individual residents.
For over twelve years we have been working with food to engage with people. We are at the forefront of a global movement, which aims to bring people back to the basic message that good food is a right for all, brings power and energy to everyone and is a joy to be shared.

properties.name: Able & Willing
properties.description:
About us
ableandwilling (a&w) are Brighton & Hove's only Supported Employer. We employ and support people with a variety of disabilities in full-time and part-time employment. Our aim always is to help staff move on into unsupported employment.

We in turn are supported by Brighton & Hove City Council (BHCC), who's valuable assistance is intrinsic to our future.

Some of our revenue comes from BHCC, but as we work as a commercial concern, we rely on external customers predominantly.

Wherever possible we aim to be environmentally friendly, and welcome site visits from potential customers to see our facilities and work conditions.

 We believe in dignity through work and fair pay for all in our business.

 a&w has helped many disabled people move on into employment, and is still helping others to do the same!

Our core values include:

Fairness and equality in everything we do
Inclusion for all
Dignity through work
Helping give independence through informed choice
Supporting staff to move to mainline employment
We are a "Living Wage" employer 
Our growing workforce contributes the local community by providing: quality digital and screen print, embroidery and assembly. Without supported employers like us many of our hard working staff would remain unemployed.

properties.name: Brighton Fringe
properties.description:
Entertainment, culture & sports, Media.
We set out to stimulate, educate and entertain a diverse range of people through a wide variety of art forms and all this in an iconic city with unique cultural heritage. 
Our vision is to be a nationally and internationally acclaimed festival and year-round professional resource that stimulates, educates and develops audiences and artistic communities. Our mission is to bring audiences and artists together and act as a catalyst for creativity. Each year we work with thousands of participants at all stages of their career, yet only 3% of our income comes from public subsidy.

properties.name: Bristol Energy Cooperative
properties.addr:housenumber: Happy City Hub 1st Floor Canningford House 38
properties.description:
Bristol Energy Cooperative (BEC) is a community-owned energy cooperative, growing Greater Bristol’s local green energy supply and making the benefits available to all. We develop  renewable energy and energy efficiency projects, and help others to do the same. We got started in 2011.
.We aim to support the creation of a resilient, robust and organised community, and respond equitably to current and future energy challenges, in particular to:
Enable meaningful cuts in carbon emissions, and reduce dependence on unsustainable sources of energy.
Fund and implement renewable energy and energy efficiency measures, in collaboration with people, communities and businesses.
Work co-operatively with people and communities to make carbon reduction technologies available to all, regardless of financial resources, and support mutual action to respond to the challenges of climate change.
We are grateful to Bristol City Council for initial seed funding through its Community Energy Catalyst Fund.

Our projects are funded by investor members, who receive interest on their investment from the money we receive for the energy we produce. Decisions are made on a one-member one-vote basis at our AGMs. We're a people-owned power station for Greater Bristol!

properties.name: The Wood Store
properties.description:
The Wood Store is the trading name for the Brighton & Hove Wood Recycling Project. We are a not-for-profit Social Enterprise saving resources and creating jobs since 1998.
When we began, hundreds of thousands of tonnes of wood was sent to landfill every year, which we thought was a terrible waste. Why not collect that unwanted wood so that it can be reused or made into useful things, creating opportunities for people to gain work experience and learn new skills at the same time. Our status as a social enterprise means that any profit we make stays within the business, enabling us to improve our facilities and conditions for our volunteers and staff. We have always had a strong focus on both environmental and financial sustainability and, apart from a small start-up grant, we operate without any financial support enabling us to be independent and do things in our own unique way.

properties.name: Rock-IT Enterprise CIC
properties.description:
We advocate and deliver a positive and sustainable environmental solution for both IT disposal and data destruction. Equipment is re-used, repaired, re-purposed and recycled for minimal landfill, at the highest recognised standards. Our company helps businesses to achieve their corporate social responsibility objectives and goals and creates new job opportunities for young people.
ROCK IT is structured as a Community Interest Company (CIC). The income generated by ROCK IT through WEEE services and donations is almost exclusively used to support employment and skills training for young people who are not in education, employment or training (NEET).

properties.name: Thraedable
properties.description:
We want a world: Where everybody has a voice. Where everybody’s rights are respected. Where sustainability is the norm. 

To build this world: We make clothes that tell stories through people’s art. We share 50% of our gross profits with grassroots organisation that defend human rights. We respect people and the planet from production to delivery. 
Wear a Story for a Just World.

Co-Creation

Each item carries the amplified voices of those that deserve to be heard. Each line is dedicated to one of our partner organisations and designed and inspired by the very population that they support.
Each line and each item tell a story to raise awareness about the issues we support. On our Project page you can read about our partner organisations and the issues that the tackle. In our Boutique, you can discover the stories behind each item.


50 Threads
Our social aim is at the heart of our philosophy, woven into the social fabric of our very company, which is why our business concept is simple: 50% of the gross profit from the sale of each item is directly invested in social projects. This means that every purchase has a substantial and immediate impact – we don’t wait for our bottom line to be positive before we fulfil our social commitment.

properties.name: Brighton Energy Cooperative
properties.description:
To raise money to install solar panels we sell shares in in Brighton Energy Coop. Shareholders become members of BEC.
