This is underpinned with the available data on finances and credit risk.Given's vision is to make business a force for good through providing holistic company data that allows our customers to make better decisions.

Given donates 10% of profits to the charity Resurgo.

properties.name: Trussel Trust East Nottingham
properties.description: We develop, run, and enable community projects that combat poverty & exclusion. The Trussell Trust is a poverty charity founded on Christian principles. We work with people of all faiths and none, but are inspired to do what we do by Jesus’ words.

properties.name: Recruit for Spouses
properties.description:
Recruit for Spouses is an award-winning, independent social enterprise, run largely by people whose spouses are serving in the Armed Forces. We exist to help military spouses find a job or start a business that works for them.

Military spouses sacrifice everything to follow their partners who are serving in the British Army, the Navy and the Royal Air Force. Recruit for Spouses is not just about finding a job. It’s about spouses re–establishing their identity and independence – building a fulfilling life that benefits them, their partners and their families.

When military spouses are able to return to the workplace, employers can tap into the talent and skills they offer – benefiting their business and the economy as a whole.

Our vision

Recruit for Spouses is leading the change towards a world where the wives, husbands and partners of our Armed Forces find it easy to secure work, rather than facing prejudice.

Where they’re no longer disadvantaged in their career. Where they’re supported, not forgotten, and where marrying into the forces no longer holds them back professionally.

We see a time when military spouses have a support network that allows them to seize opportunities and to build the lifestyle they dream of. Their military connection becomes an enabler not a barrier. They are inspired and empowered to take action. Their lives are made easier by employers who support their goals.

In turn, businesses benefit from the vast pool of resourceful, resilient and adaptable talent that has lain untapped for so many years.

Our vision of the future is a win-win situation for military spouses and employers alike. It alters the way military spouses live and work, shapes the way businesses source and retain quality employees, and changes the perception of Forces’ spouses as a transient workforce.

properties.name: Evolving Communities CIC
properties.description:
Healthwatch Wiltshire is the county’s independent health and care champion.  It exists to ensure that people are at the heart of care.
The Health and Social Care Act of 2012 put people at the centre of their health and social care.  To help realise that ambition, a Healthwatch organisation was set up in every local authority area across England.  Each one is a key part of its local community, and works in partnership with other organisations in its area.  For Healthwatch Wiltshire, this includes Wiltshire Council, the NHS, local hospitals and voluntary organisations.
Healthwatch Wiltshire is the county’s independent health and care champion.  It exists to ensure that people are at the heart of care.
Dedicated teams of staff and volunteers listen to what people like about local health services, and what could be improved.  These views are then shared with the decision-making organisations, so together a real difference can be made.
Healthwatch Wiltshire can also help people find the information they need about health and care services in their area.
The Healthwatch Wiltshire service is run by Evolving Communities CIC, a community interest company limited by guarantee and run by a Board of Directors who are responsible for its strategy and overall management.
Our priorities
Our priorities are informed by what people tell us.  By having working relationships with local health and social care leaders, this enables us to hear what concerns and issues there are, but also how services are provided for our populations.  Being a partner at the table means we are able to have a direct influence.  Our work plan priorities are monitored by the Evolving Communities Board on a quarterly basis.
Our priorities for 2017/18 include:
Dementia and mental health – engaging with people living with dementia to ensure they are receiving services as laid out in the Wiltshire Dementia Strategy, and monitoring the quality of adult mental health services by listening to those who use these services.
Children and Young People – engaging with children and young people in schools through the Young Listeners project. Looking specifically at the provision of mental health services within the school structure.
Primary care – our Annual Event this year will look specifically at primary and community services and will take the style of a roadshow, which will see Healthwatch Wiltshire visiting each local community area to talk directly to local people.
How health and social care services work together – engaging with patients and their carers and staff to find out their experiences of receiving care under numerous schemes funded through the Better Care Plan.

properties.name: Partnership of Equals CIC
properties.description:
Social entreneurship.
Choose one of our stunning templates
Create a professional online presence
Attract more customers
No technical experience needed

properties.name: Hurtwood Ltd
properties.description:
Hurtwood manufacture an innovative range of retrofit controls products that allow users to upgrade, rapidly and cost-effectively, older BMS to modern systems - unleashing a host of benefits.

Our flagship product is the Satrofit range of input and output cards and terminal unit controllers that provide an easy upgrade route for older Satchwell, Staefa and Sauter BMS equipment to a system of your choice.  

Satrofit is also a powerful IO system that allows a non BMS trained engineer to fully commission the field sensors and outputs prior to integration into a larger BMS.  

Find out more or visit satrofit.co.uk.


Welcome
to
Hurtwood
Title Banner
Fact: Most Building Management Systems

Waste Energy & Money
Provide Poor Control
Cost far more than they should

We believe that it doesn’t have to be this way and we know that it can be vastly improved.


Hurtwood are one of the foremost experts on building management system strategy, helping clients to navigate through the complexities of refurbishing often obsolete BMS. We can ensure that clients derive the maximum value from an investment that can be worth many hundreds of thousands of pounds.

BMS is changing. New products and solutions can deliver significant energy savings - after all, we waste 50% of the energy we put into our buildings - while at the same time, improving environmental control and reducing maintenance costs.

At a tactical level, we can review the control within a wide variety of BMS and manage the changes to achieve significant and rapid improvements in energy efficiency.

Typically, clients can expect 10-15% energy savings for low capital cost and short payback periods.

properties.name: The Sound Doctor
properties.description:
Our mission
To create top quality information presented in a meaningful and accessible way so people understand their own health conditions better, manage them more successfully and improve their quality of life as a result.

The Sound Doctor was founded by Dominic Arkwright and Rosie Runciman.
Dominic worked at the BBC for more than 20 years, mostly on Radio 4 's Today Programme as well as Newsnight and PM. He also presented discussion programme 'Off the Page' and 'The Call' on Radio 4.

Rosie Runciman also worked at the BBC for more than 20 years on Radio 4's Today programme, Newsnight, Radio 5 Live and at The World Service.
All those who work on The Sound Doctor team are passionate about the quality of what we do and the importance of effective patient education.
The Sound Doctor produces Health Today Radio
The Sound Doctor radio team, lead by Dominic, Rosie and Isobel Eaton (BBC Newsnight, one of the inaugural producers of the Jeremy Vine show on Radio 2, documentary maker of note) also created 'Health Today Radio' for NHS England .

This innovative and compelling weekly radio magazine programme full of music, celebrities talking about health issues, information about a wide variety of different conditions and inspirational stories, was devised to increase the number of people engaging in health matters.

properties.name: Sofab sports cic
properties.description:
Sofab Sports is a Community Interest Company that builds the skills, confidence and self esteem of young adults with physical and learning difficulties through developing businesses that create supportive employment opportunities leading to vocational qualifications and experience, providing a platform for further mainstream employment opportunities.

In addition, Sofab Sports provides graduate opportunities as heads of the divisions to nurture future business leaders and entrepreneurs.

The motivation for doing this is to enhance communities’ attitudes to social inclusion, and provide young disadvantaged and non disadvantaged adults leaving education with experience to shape the business and leadership skills of tomorrow.

Sofab Sports encourages all its’ employees to be the best that they can be.

Sofab recognises that everybody learns – just at different rates.

The profit generated from trading is totally retained within the business for the benefit of pursuing social missions.

properties.name: EdCentral Limited
properties.description:
EdCentral is an independent, not-for-profit social enterprise - set up to support busy teachers and help them be the best they can be.

Our small but dedicated team curates and signposts education news, policy and research and presents it in a no-frills, easily accessible format. Alongside this, our own content is produced by teachers and education experts and is designed to inform, inspire and amuse.

We also provide a friendly online space where all educators - teachers, lecturers, school leaders, student teachers, NQTs, teaching assistants and supply teachers - can share ideas and support one another.

Our vision is to empower educators to drive school improvement and pupil outcomes by keeping them well-informed and offering them a safe, independent place where they can discover new ways of thinking, network with one another, and build helpful, collaborative relationships.

properties.name: EBICO
properties.description:
Our mission at Ebico is to help those who are affected by fuel poverty.

Our mission at Ebico is to help those who are affected by fuel poverty.  To do this, we provide attractively priced plans designed for customers who find that their home energy costs are a major item of their household expenditure and who, therefore, need to budget prudently, either by being as efficient in energy use as possible, or through the use of a prepayment meter.  We use the financial surpluses from doing this to support local hands-on projects in fuel-poor neighbourhoods across Britain via the Ebico Trust, our registered charity[1].

That is what we mean by Power for Purpose.

We are an established Oxfordshire based company that has been in business for over 16 years. We provide energy to over 60,000 UK households who have found our social mission and market-leading customer services[2] and value appealing. Our licensed supply partner is Robin Hood Energy who provides both our energy and the account management services.

properties.name: Maymessy Community Interest Company
properties.description:
Working with children
Everything that Maymessy does has been designed with the School Food Plan in mind, and all the team is trained in child safeguarding and DBS-checked. With cooking having been compulsory up to the end of KS3 since 2014, Maymessy shares the National Curriculum’s ambition of “instilling a love of cooking” in children of all ages. Practical kitchen know-how will be shared along with our real-world passion for food.

Gardening, too, is being increasingly talked about by teachers and governors. Maymessy also exists to inspire youngsters to become more green-fingered. Children visiting the centre will be able to work on the vegetable plot, get to grips with the pots and pans, and finally sit down to scoff a plate of their own yummy and nutritious food. The communal aspects of enjoying food together are just as important as preparing it.

Guest chefs, as well as Maymessy’s own staff, will host courses and workshops. Maymessy’s kitchen is kitted out with state-of-the-art equipment across six cooking stations that can be used by up to 12 children at a time. Naturally, fresh air and hearty exercise are “on tap”.

Working with adults
Courses for young adults will operate in similar way — with the aim of offering accredited qualifications that can help people gain new skills and enhance their employability.

properties.name: Social Bite
properties.description: Social Bite is on a mission to bring Scotland together, to build a collaborative movement to end homelessness here. To do that we need to make houses available to the homeless, we need to fund a support resource for people to sustain their tenancies, and we need to integrate these vulnerable and marginalised people back into society – where they belong.

properties.name: Repair Cafe Cambridge
properties.description:
This cafe is Cambridge's first. Repair Cafés are free meeting places and they’re all about repairing things (together). In the place where a Repair Café is located, you’ll find tools and materials to help you make any repairs you need. On clothes, furniture, electrical appliances, bicycles, crockery, appliances, toys, et cetera. You’ll also find expert volunteers, with repair skills in all kinds of fields.
Visitors bring their broken items from home. Together with the specialists they start making their repairs in the Repair Café. It’s an ongoing learning process. If you have nothing to repair, you can enjoy a cup of tea or coffee. Or you can lend a hand with someone else’s repair job. You can also get inspired at the reading table – by leafing through books on repairs and DIY.

properties.name: THE MELTING POT
properties.description: The Melting Pot provides spaces for individuals and organisations to work, connect, meet and hold events. The only facility of its type in Scotland, The Melting Pot is a not-for-profit social enterprise that aims to inspire and support people to realise their ideas for a better world.

properties.name: KIBBLE EDUCATION AND CARE CENTRE
properties.description: he award-winning Kibble Education and Care Centre in Paisley works with some of the most troubled and troublesome adolescent boys from across Scotland and the North of England. They provide a range of specialist services incorporating preventative and rehabilitative communities

properties.name: myfastestmile c.i.c.
properties.description:
myfastestmile is a social enterprise that aims to help people better themselves through sport. We work with partners to develop and deliver novel engagement and support methods, underpinned by the science of complexity and ecological dynamics, to help performers become creative problems solvers, to help coaches become effective learning designers and to help organisations and funding bodies achieve their societal aims by more fully attending to the learning and development of their people.

We live in a complex and evolving world. How do we learn & adapt in order to be our best, whether a performer, coach, team, club or organisation? You have the answers — we will help you discover them

we believe all learning is situated…
…so we seek to understand the spatial and temporal dynamics of each situation
 
…and resist the urge to assume that we’ve seen this before and know ‘the answer’
we believe all behaviour is goal directed…

…so we seek to engage and understand people’s motivation
 
…and resist the urge to assume that we’re all here for the same reasons
we believe the future is emergent and uncertain…


…so we stay nimble and manage in the moment
 
…and resist the urge to predict the future and attempt to manage it with long term strategy plans

properties.name: Ethical Legal Services trading as Beacon
properties.description:
The experienced team at Beacon have been sought out by various public, private and third sector organisations to provide expert advice and training on a range NHS Continuing Healthcare related matters over the last decade, cementing our position as a leading independent authority on the subject.

For over 13 years our caseworkers have been commissioned by Strategic Health Authorities, Primary Care Trusts, Clinical Commissioning Groups and Local Authorities to provide expert independent advice, casework and advocacy to individuals at any stage of the continuing healthcare assessment or appeal process.

We were part of the team writing the new national NHS continuing healthcare E-Learning programme. Working with NHS England we were commissioned to co-write the Dispute Resolution module and to quality check other modules. In 2014 we joined the NHS England Continuing Healthcare Stakeholder Group, and in 2015 we were commissioned by NHS England to set up and pilot England’s first independent NHS continuing healthcare information and advice service.

properties.name: Chatterbugs
properties.description:
We are a Social Enterprise based in Leeds, working with a range of schools and families across the UK.
ChatterBug was established in 2008 after recognising the lack of speech and language therapy available for children, especially those from less privileged backgrounds.

properties.name: SCARF
properties.description: Scarf is a vibrant social enterprise, headquartered in Aberdeen and delivering services across the north east. Scarf offers free and impartial energy efficiency advice and information through the Home Energy Scotland programme (funded by the Scottish Government and managed by the Energy Saving Trust) and the Home Energy Advice Team (HEAT – funded and supported by local authorities throughout the region). The support aims to help people reduce their fuel use and energy spend. Scarf also offers business services, helping organisations reduce their energy spend and improve their environmental credentials. In partnership with another social enterprise, Citrus Energy, Scarf provides a commercial energy switching service too. Training services are also available from Scarf, with accredited courses in energy efficiency and renewable energy available, as well as the delivery of personal development programmes from the Pacific Institute.

properties.name: Agile Collective
properties.description:
We are a team of digital developers and designers, based in the UK and Italy. We work with open source software and agile methodologies and place a strong emphasis on user experience. We are specialists in developing sites for charities, NGOs, educational institutions. We specialise in development using Drupal content management system (CMS) but also work extensively with other platforms including Wordpress.

As a socially minded company, we contribute to our communities, seek to minimise our environmental impact and ensure sustainability in our work practices. 

Agile Collective is a Worker Co-operative

Our company is governed as a worker co-operative. Our legal structure is that of a limited company but our articles and memorandum of association lay out the co-operative principles by which we own and govern the company.

In practice this means that all full time employees can become a member of the co-operative to take an equal ownership and control of the company. As we are not working to make profit for third party investors or owners, all profit is reinvested into the company to improve our services and further our mission. This engenders a great sense of ownership, responsibility and engagement from all staff and a strong dedication to the clients we work with and their objectives.

properties.name: RAW Workshop
properties.description:
Social Impact

Every month we create over 1,400 hours of human social impact. That includes skills, training, employment, positive activity and life-skills. This reduces isolation, raises self-esteem, lowers the call on blue-light and NHS services, combats depression/mental health illness and gives people somewhere of which they are proud to be a part. 
Our Truths:

We produce high quality products, offer superb services and work with many corporate, education,  local government and private customers
We employ, train and support people from our communities who face prejudice and barriers to work. Over 85% of our team will be striving to succeed in the face of issues such as physical or learning difficulties, mental health illness, recovery from addiction and criminal histories.

properties.name: Berinsfield Community Business
properties.description:
WHY CHOOSE BCB?
 
BCB is a social enterprise founded in October 2001 and an independent partner of Soha Housing. The idea for setting up a social enterprise came from wanting to do more than physical regeneration in the village of Berinsfield. We believe that our social objectives are every bit as important as our financial objectives. That’s why we support community initiatives throughout Berinsfield and Oxfordshire by gifting 10% of our annual operational profits on a voluntary basis.
 
WHY A COMMUNITY BUSINESS?
 
The crux of BCB is that it is locally founded, in terms of location, approach to housing management and staff employed. 80% of all staff employed are residents of Berinsfield, our way of supporting our local community.
 
BCB is a progressive property, grounds and garden maintenance business formed as a company limited by guarantee. We have no shareholders and operate with a board of volunteers who manage an experienced team of twenty.
 
THE NAME IN OXFORDSHIRE YOU CAN TRUST...
 
BCB provides sustainable employment and training opportunities for local people whilst enhancing the quality of service delivered to individuals and organisations within our community. We meet our objectives by providing social housing management, care-taking & cleaning, repairs management and grounds maintenance services for 320 general needs properties owned by Soha Housing in Berinsfield, Oxfordshire. We also deliver grounds maintenance, communal cleaning and void cleaning services to Sovereign, Cottsway and Southern Housing Group housing associations, together with grounds maintenance and cleaning services for councils, businesses and private customers across the Thames Valley.

properties.name: Pioneers Post
properties.description:
News, views, knowledge and analysis on business and finance driving social progress.
Pioneers Post delivers the news and sets the agenda for the new wave of responsible business leaders and social entrepreneurs.

Our aim is to create intelligent and engaging content through news, analysis, comment, profiles, debate, specialist reports, the Pioneers Post Business School and our own online TV and podcast channels.

A growing movement of corporate businesses, SMEs, charities and social enterprises is looking beyond the immediate bottom line and seeing value and opportunity in social innovation, sustainability, investment and creating meaningful business at scale.

Social entrepreneurs are seeking to increase their size and impact; corporate leaders are bringing social value and environmental values closer to the heart of their business; charity and public sector CEOs are sharpening their business skills and creating new models to deliver effective, innovative services in challenging economic circumstances.

Pioneers Post is the magazine that brings these people, their organisations and their stories together into a dedicated platform – championing their vision, sharing their ideas, testing their mettle, and exploring their challenges, successes and failures.

Aims & Values
Pioneers Post is itself a social enterprise, with clear social aims and profits ploughed back to support our community of socially progressive readers.

We have an innovative, 'hybrid' legal structure which safeguards our community purpose and social values but also includes a proportion of privately owned shares that allow for future investment.

Our community interest purpose is to inspire, nourish, support, promote and bring together the community of social entrepreneurs, social innovators and social investors across public, private and civil society sectors.

We aim to build the success of social business, to promote shared value, social responsibility and sustainability alongside entrepreneurship, innovation and business excellence.

We aim…

– To be the most insightful source of news, views and opportunities in social value and social enterprise

– To provide advice, skills and knowledge to help do social entrepreneurship better

– To discover and scrutinise new ideas in policy and practice 

– To challenge the status quo across charity, public and business sectors

– To champion and question the legitimacy and impact of social enterprise at the global, national and local levels

– To explore what makes social entrepreneurship work and why it sometimes goes wrong

– To understand and profile the people behind social innovation and what motivates them

– To showcase and celebrate great examples of social entrepreneurship across charity, public and commercial sectors

– To connect people with conversations about social innovation

– To be a critical link in a community of people who are making change in different sectors and silos

– To approach our subject matter with honesty, pragmatism (get real), good humour and with a sense of fun.

properties.name: World Experience Exchange
properties.description:
We help charities build novel projects. And staff and resource these projects with, students, professional volunteers and corporate teams.
Our story
WE2 is a Social Enterprise formed by two MBA students following their experiences on a Social Entrepreneurship MBA module in Uganda.
 
We realised that there was an opportunity to bring a wide range of professional skills and expertise for the benefit of charities and NGOs in a new and more meaningful way – exchanging the professionals' experience for the life and practical experience of Africa.
 
WE2 initiated a partnership between Westminster Business School and Busoga Trust to provide experienced MBA students who apply their commercial experience and academic learning to the charity’s development projects. 
This has proved very beneficial and productive to both organisations – and we realised that this approach would be of great value to many other organisations and individuals.
So, we established our social enterprise WE2 to expand the benefits of this model to other NGOs, charities, social enterprises, academic institutions and individuals.
 
During a subsequent visit to Uganda, we identified a wealth of project opportunities which could make a significant difference to people’s lives. 
We are keen to identify further academic organisations and experienced individuals to bring their knowledge and talents to the greatest effect in the developing world, in exchange for a new breadth of life & practical experience.
 WEE - Exchanging Experiences across the World
"we-squared" the power of you and them, to benefit both

properties.name: Common Grounds Belfast
properties.description:
Fair trade cafe- coffee and ethically sourced food and more. We’re the only café in the city with a community garden.
We seek to be a safe and welcoming place, particularly for those who have come to Belfast to find a better way of living. We host the catering skills training project Global Kitchen – one of our current charity partners, along with South Belfast Foodbank which we host every Wednesday afternoon.
Common Grounds is a place for relationships to develop, companionships to be enjoyed and differences to be celebrated and appreciated.

properties.name: Tea People Ltd
properties.description:
Our Philosophy
We believe that 'tea is what you make it'. Tea can be different things to different people and with a little effort, creativity and innovation, it can even become a powerful medium for social change.

 

Our Vision
At Tea People our vision is to be the biggest marketplace for a wide variety of fine, specialty and fun teas and be the 'go to' place for all things  tea.

 

Our Commitment
Sell only the best tea and to never knowingly compromise on quality.

Strive to meet the highest expectations of all our customers at all times.

Be ethical in all our transactions.

Put aside at least half of our net profits for the cause of improving the lives of the underprivileged communities in and around the tea growing regions.

properties.name: Just Change Tea
properties.description:
Just Change UK is a voluntary organisation that trades in the UK on behalf of the adivasi (indigenous) people of South India on their terms. We sell their tea and other products at a price that’s fair for the producers and for the buyers. It’s fair because they set the price themselves.

We are part of the global Just Change movement that originated in India. There, thousands of people are connected through Just Change community trade links. Find out more about how Just Change works.

You can be part of it by buying delicious, South Indian Just Change tea and other products [link to sales page], or involving your community in the global Just Change network [link to get involved page].

leaf

“Perhaps one day we will have a society where we can proudly say the poor are no longer with us. Because poverty has been eradicated and not just alleviated, because justice has been done.” Stan Thekaekara, Just Change Founder, India

properties.name: Cairde Teo
properties.description: CAIRDE  is the Irish language translation of ‘friends’; it is also an acronym for ‘Communities in Armagh Investing in Regeneration, Diversity and Enterprise’. (Teo is Irish for ‘Ltd’). Our third sector company focuses on micro-business incubation; employment, training and learning opportunities and action research projects. CAIRDE Teo also works in partnership with a number of institutions and organisations in Armagh City and throughout the island to promote and develop the use of the Irish language both locally and nationally.

properties.name: Cordell Health Ltd
properties.description:
A social enterprise has been described as a dynamic, ethical and sustainable way of doing business, values which are aligned with those of Cordell Health Ltd. 

Our vision is to enable businesses to provide a working environment where all employees are engaged, productive and well. 

Our mission is to provide high quality evidence based consultancy and occupational health services to support businesses in becoming highly productive through effective management of the health and wellbeing of their employees. By adopting models which encourage employee engagement, and include the provision of a supportive, healthy workplace, businesses can make a significant improvement in employee retention and business performance.  

To support our mission, we are focused on early intervention and expert support to HR and management, and use innovation and best practice methods to deliver affordable occupational health services in partnership with clients.  

We have a responsibility to ensure advice we give to businesses and their employees is based on the best available published scientific evidence.  Our core value is integrity, which we demonstrate in everything we do, providing high value yet affordable occupational health interventions to business. 

We are a responsible employer and lead our staff by this example. We are committed to excellence and ethical practice.  We ensure this by investing in regular high quality training for all our staff. We also believe in developing the next generation of clinical occupational health staff to help support our mission and as such are involved in all aspects of professional training.

properties.name: Unlock Your Wellbeing CIC
properties.description:
We are passionate about, and dedicated to, improving the wellbeing of people in our communities, and we offer a variety of ways to achieve this. Whether at work or at home, one to one or in a group setting, we can support you in making changes to make your life more meaningful. We want you to be thriving not just surviving and for you to find more meaning and purpose in your life.
Work should be a stimulating and enjoyable place - but we know that for many people it is stressful. We are working with employers and employees to change this.
Good mental health is vital to us all and we will work in different ways to reduce the stigma and allow people to find meaning and purpose - we have seen this happen many many times - there is hope.

properties.name: Essex Dynamic Care Ltd
properties.description:
Who are TW Care Services?
We take pride in delivering high standards of HOME CARE. Hence, our staff are well trained and screened. We are also an accredited training centre with a fast growing awarding body.

Training....................................
We offer Vocational training:
- Level 2 Award in awareness of Dementia (QCF)
- Level 3 Certificate in principles of Dementia Care (QCF)

Short Courses...........................
All mandatory Training in Health and Social Care ie... Moving & Handling, Infection Control, Health & Safety, Training for First Time Carers

properties.name: beesignificant
properties.description: Protection of bees in the local environment.  Bee monitoring and conservation.

properties.name: Your Living Room CIC
properties.description:
Your Living Room CIC (Community Interest Company), providing all our clients with a peace of mind knowing that we are:

Fully insured
Registered
Have a waste carriers licence
A member of the Association of Professional Declutterers and Organisers
All staff have an enhanced DBS clearance check
Your Living Room aims to deliver a person centred service, to residents throughout Essex, that is accessible to all. Our vision is to make a home as functional, comfortable and organised as possible, according to the preferences and personality of the individual client, whilst improving their quality of life and maintaining their dignity.
Our fully trained practitioners work closely with the client’s family/guardians, social landlords, floating support and social care as part of the multi-agency approach, looking to ensure that a realistic ‘aftercare support plan’ is agreed and maintained for the client, beyond the decluttering process.

Your Living Room’s optional ‘aftercare’  service would aim to ensure that the client is not only able to return to living, in a safe, manageable and agreeable existence but can also access additional support e.g.: a person-centred BACP counsellor, qualified therapist or attend our User-led forum if appropriate.

We encourage clients to be involved in the decision making process throughout as it helps to achieve their ‘vision of a good life’ and re-establishes their independence going forward.

properties.name: Strengths in Communities CIC trading as Parents 1st
properties.description:
Parents 1st promotes sustainable, effective and nationally acclaimed peer support programmes that enable the 'Community Parent' concept to flourish. By 'Community Parents' we mean mothers, fathers, grandparents and carers. Our passion is building on the strengths and skills of parents living in less advantaged communities. Relationships are at the heart of support. Informal early prevention in the heart of local communities empowers parents to cope well from the beginning.

Community Parents are important intermediaries who carry out a role midway between that of a professional and a friend. They also assist parents to ‘take the first step’ into accessing local services before problems become entrenched and difficult to resolve. A Community Parent has particular personal qualities. By offering advocacy, informal support, useful information and encouragement to other local parents they can reach those who are wary of professionals, building bridges to help all parents to feel valued and supported.
Organisations we work with typically deliver children’s centre, extended schools or Healthy Child services. Community Parent roles span the 0-19 pathway including Pregnancy Pals, Birth Buddies (doulas), Breastfeeding Supporters, Community Mothers and Community Fathers.

properties.name: NTA Workshops
properties.contact:phone: Tel Chris: 07859 031938 Tel Tracy: 07591 592113   Send  Facebook App Icon Twitter App Icon
properties.description:
NTA Core Values:
Learning through exploration and experimentation within a confident and safeguarded environment
Explore learning through physical demonstration
Encourage creativity and experimentation
Deliver products that are tailor-made for our clients
Create a fun, friendly, safe and rewarding atmosphere
Develop and improve children’s confidence, social skills, meta-cognition, and self belief
Develop and improve children’s concentration, problem solving, teamwork, sharing, and communication skills
 
The Services NTA offers include After school clubs, Holiday workshops and Weekly Performers Clubs.

properties.name: The Mediation and Advice Project
properties.description:
We are a Social Enterprise which means we’re a company with a social mission. It may sound like charity work, but we operate like any other business except we do one thing differently - we re-invest our profits to do more good for the community, we work for people not profit.
The Mediation and Advice Project is a Social Enterprise company that provides affordable and sustainable community mediation, social welfare advice and training services to all. Our objectives are to:
Promote the use of interpersonal communication and mediation as a way of resolving problems and disputes and to champion community cohesion.
Improve and maintain the well-being of the community through the provision of social welfare advice.
Build skills and confidence through the delivery of training, to provide better opportunities in life.

properties.name: Lighthouse Furniture Project Ltd
properties.description:
Our Mission

Prevent reusable items going to landfill and use them to help those in need by providing good quality second-hand furniture, white goods, computers and household items at affordable prices.
A Not-for-Profit Social enterprise where 100% of funds raised are used to help those in need or are reinvested into growing the organisations services. Read more

A Charity that provides essential items to those on low income at significantly reduced prices and in some instances for free. Read more

A volunteering opportunity provider who works with a range of local agencies to provide support for individuals that have been marginalised, through ill health, long term unemployment or life experiences as well as individuals who just want to give something back to their local community. Read more

ReUse not ReCycling our goal is to reuse, not recycle, but we do ensure that anything we can’t reuse is recycled if possible.  

Many of the items donated to us would have gone to land fill if they had not come to us. Read more

In 2016 Lighthouse, along with its sister projects

REUSED 585 tonnes.

This equates to over 12000 sofas

properties.name: Thurrock Lifestyle Solutions CIC
properties.description:
As a social enterprise we recognise that trading for profit is not a bad thing and our assets are locked to the community. So for us, it's all about what you do with those assets and the profit. This means that we hold our social mission central to what we do - but over 80% of our income still comes from selling or trading in services.

Our formal articles of association list our objects as; "To promote an understanding of what disabled people by reducing and removing the barriers they face using the social model of disability approach and to help disabled people to become integral and active members of the communities in which they live". This is key to all the services we provide.

Being driven by a group of disabled people means that we have a long history of collaborative working and understand the true meaning of working co-productively. We started really small in 2007 with some interested Disabled people and some forward thinking staff meeting in an old Scout Hut in Chadwell-St-Mary. This progressed through winning a DOH pathfinder award, gaining social enterprise fund investment, winning a 'spin out' contract to take over all the disability provider services from the Council to recently being listed as the number one SE100 index measured social enterprise in the Eastern region.

We now own 4 residential properties, a Camper van, lease 8 vehicles, an office and 5 locality buildings - supporting over 250 disabled people aged 16 - 78 to live the lives of their choice through over 80 support staff providing over 3000 hours per week.

properties.name: Harper Performance
properties.description:
OUR MISSION

HARPER PERFORMANCE exists with the express goal of becoming the go-to consultancy to deliver performance-transformation for aspirational, high performance sports organisations, clubs and individual athletes with limited resources, and to those hamstrung by logistical, financial and socio-cultural challenges. 

HARPER PERFORMANCE fiercely champions the underdog to genuinely compete with the very best by providing accessible, relevant and sustainable performance-support programmes to some of the most disadvantaged and marginalised athletes on the planet.  We believe that barriers to sporting excellence can be overcome through effective, totally bespoke and locally driven innovation when supported by up-to-date evidence-based theory, practice-based experience and proven delivery mechanisms.

properties.name: Local Food (+More!) Co-operative
properties.description:
Our Co-operative community is a vibrant and diverse collective of people, including current active members and those who have already supported the project by sharing news and developments to a wider audience.

A group of local residents recently revived a disused allotments site, which now has 26 plots for individuals and 2 community plots for wider community use. This brought many members of our diverse community together for a common goal, but also highlighted the fact that the village lacks a cohesive centre or hub for people to come together.
Several local foodies set up a monthly market, partly to raise funds for the allotments by selling refreshments, but also to provide a meeting place for residents to get together for a community mingle.
As a consequence, Local Food (& More) was born, with the aim of creating a multi-functional hub for the village, showcasing local talents and cottage industries and thereby promoting local employment, offering volunteering opportunities and harnessing the talents and skills of local people.
Local Food (& More!) is also an ideal weekend meeting place to get together or to stop off and have a coffee at the Green Café, after your stroll, cycle or horse ride on the Flitch Way.

Any new organisation needs to think about the type of business model to adopt - in our case, we knew that we wanted to form some type of social enterprise - a business with social aims at its centre, rather than private profit. The Co-operative ideals really tie in with our project - here's a brief section from Co-operatives UK website which explains it:
"Co-operatives are businesses owned and run by and for their members, whether they are customers, employees or residents. As well as giving members an equal say and share of the profits, co-operatives act together to build a better world through co-operation.
There are over 5,450 independent co-operatives in the UK. From football to fashion, health care to housing, community owned shops to credit unions, and wind farms to web design; co-operatives work in all parts of the economy.
Co-operatives are not just supermarkets and funeral services - although these are amongst the most successful co-operatives found on the high street. You probably use co-operatives in your daily life that you aren't even aware of.
Across the UK, co-operatives are owned by nearly 13 million people - and these numbers keep on growing."

properties.name: Hearts Milk Bank CIC
properties.description:
The Hearts Milk Bank is the UK’s newest milk bank. We aim to bring a new approach to the provision of milk bank services in the UK.

The HMB will offer equity of access to safe and assured supplies of donor human milk to hospitals and community-based clinicians for patients across London and the southeast of England.

As a centre of research, we are planning wide-ranging new programmes of studies into milk banking and human milk.

Our vision is to make a positive contribution to the health outcomes of the premature, sick and vulnerable infants in their care, while positively supporting breastfeeding in our community and beyond.

properties.name: WEConnect Europe
properties.description:
WEConnect International in Europe is a non-profit organisation that is opening doors to new supply chains. Led by corporate members, it certifies firms that are at least 51% owned, managed and controlled by women and connects them with the growing global demand from corporations and the public sector for diverse and innovative suppliers. The organisation partners with corporations, associations, governments, women entrepreneurs and their supporters, and is affiliated with a global certification network for women-owned enterprises.

WEConnect International in Europe also facilitates the building of strong networks for women by connecting them both with procurement officers of top corporations and with other certified firms in order to enhance bidding capacity, and creates the opportunity of business to business contracting.

properties.name: Families Feeling Safe Ltd
properties.description:
Our vision is to promote the ethos that everyone has the right to feel safe in their community

We Work with parents and children and train the professionals who work with them.Families Feeling Safe Protective Behaviours Service was formed by Fiona Benjamin and Dave Austin in February 2014. Our service continues and builds upon the Protective Behaviours services that had been run in Hertfordshire by Action for Children, and managed by Fiona since 2003.

Fiona and Dave met in 1998 at a Protective Behaviours training course. They both became Protective Behaviour trainers in 2000 and in 2007 began working together to create the Families Feeling Safe Protective Behaviours Programme for Mums, Dads and Carers which was published in 2011. The programme grew out of the Protective Behaviours based parenting work that Fiona was doing in Hertfordshire and Dave was doing in Bedfordshire.

Fiona and Dave’s inspiration and passion for Protective Behaviours has led to the development of further Protective Behaviours based programmes, training and a service to deliver them which has grown by working in partnership with a range of organisations with funding from local authorities, Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services (CAMHS), national children’s charities, schools and individual settings.

“Their knowledge experience and passion is evident in what they do” (Course participant)

“This service has a fantastic track record of delivering what they said they would do” (Commissioner of services)

“Families Feeling Safe, Protective Behaviours Service delivered over and above what they were commissioned to do.” (Commissioner of services)

properties.name: We Do Stories
properties.description:
We like to think we're different to your average communication agency, we're driven by the desire to see positive change through connecting people and releasing their full potential. By focusing on brand storytelling we're able to grab people's attention in a noisy world, build longer lasting relationships and appeal to the parts of the brain that make decisions and feel a connection.

For small to medium business owners and non-profit organisations, effectively communicating your brand message and building beneficial relationships can be tricky and it's often hard to know where to start. This leads to a confused content marketing strategy with different organisations involved with small segments of their message. Potential customers and supporters don't know if they are coming and going and soon leave for a clearer option.

We work with SMEs & Non-profit organisations to grow, develop, produce and promote clear messages that resonate with their audience and build relationships beyond transactions. By overseeing the process we help you identify what you want to say with a clear idea of who you want to say it to and how you're going to say it. We don't stop there, we produce your content and help your team promote it to maximise the reach of your brand.

properties.name: WOODCRAFT FOLK
properties.description:
At Woodcraft Folk we believe passionately in equality and co-operation: everyone is welcome to join our groups.
Every week thousands of volunteers and young people meet in school halls, community venues and a host of other places to learn about big ideas through fun activities like singing, camping, playing and debating. 
Our aim is to have great fun, but also to try to develop children’s self-confidence and build their awareness of society around them.

Through our activities, outings and camps we help our members:
To understand important issues like the environment, world debt and global conflict.
Developing activities focused on sustainable development.
To encourage children to think, hoping that they will help build a peaceful, fairer world.

properties.name: Otley Community Land Trust
properties.description: The group aims to help residents create and run sustainable, affordable homes - on a co-housing model - as a way of tackling the housing crisis.

properties.name: FRIENDS OF GALLOWS HILL
properties.description:
Gallows Hill is a peaceful and increasingly diverse place, situated along a stretch of the River Wharfe in Otley. It is a habitat for a great many species of wildlife, most notably the Common Toads which can be found in the pond in large numbers.

Our membership has grown substantially over the past year and we have lots of plans for the future, including a new Community Orchard and Forest Garden. Explore the site to find out more!

properties.name: YORKSHIRE WILDLIFE TRUST
properties.description: Yorkshire Wildlife Trust is a local charity working to protect and conserve Yorkshire's wild places and wildlife for all to enjoy. We care for 104 nature reserves in Yorkshire (3,015 hectares) including iconic sites such as Spurn National Nature Reserve, Staveley Nature Reserve, Potteric Carr and Flamborough Cliffs.

properties.name: CLARA VALE CONSERVATION GROUP
properties.description:
he volunteers of the Clara Vale Conservation Group manage the Clara Vale Local Nature Reserve, working in partnership with Gateshead Council to improve it for both wildlife and people.

Every resident of Clara Vale is automatically a member of the CVCG, however it is entirely at their discretion whether or not to take an active role.

The Group hold meetings in the Village Hall roughly every month to discuss progress on current and upcoming projects and management concerns.

We hold regular ‘task days’ when volunteers are invited to help with a variety of tasks or projects, including grassland management, coppicing, clearing of scrub, plant identification etc.  More detailed projects, such as fencing or structural changes as finances permit, are more likely to be carried out by contractors with assistance from Group volunteers.

At certain times we also hold events, for example bird ringing, tours of the Reserve, and bird identification. Details of upcoming events are in the blog and tagged under the ‘Events’ category.

As a not-for-profit voluntary organisation, we are always looking for funding. We are grateful of donations towards the upkeep of the reserve, the cost of bird seed, information leaflets, tools, equipment and training. If you have enjoyed our unique resource please consider a small donation.

properties.name: SHE Fest Sheffield
properties.description:
Founded and curated by three Sheffield based social entrepreneurs (Beckie, Ali & Nitya) as a not-for-profit organisation, after connecting through charitable and human rights events. Now voted as one of the Best UK Festivals for International Women’s Day 2016 by the International Business Times.Create a platform to celebrate and promote gender equality
Provide a flagship celebration in line with International Women’s Day and coordination of similar events across the city
Develop supportive networks and empowering opportunities for self-defining women
Increase the number and diversity of women engaging in International Women’s Day celebrations

properties.name: Roshni Sheffield Asian Women’s Resource Centre
properties.description: Roshni which means ‘light’ is a not-for-profit charity. It was set up in 1992 to address the needs and aspirations of Asian women living and working in Sheffield. Asian women are regularly cited in research as a minority group experiencing multiple barriers and disadvantage. The women are often experiencing isolation because of cultural re-adjustment, racial prejudice and urban deprivation. They are also disadvantaged by  low self-esteem, lack of self confidence, a lack of information about the workings of society and by a lack of knowledge of social agencies and how best to use them.

properties.name: WAI YIN SOCIETY
properties.description: Wai Yin Society has been supporting, empowering and working in partnership with Chinese individuals and families since 1988, when we were founded by a group of community-minded Chinese women. Since then, Wai Yin has become one of the largest BME community centres in the UK, sustaining its operations through commissions and contracts with mainstream organisations. As the society has grown, we have developed a range of employment, education and community services for Chinese men and women and for other ethnic minority groups, including Somali, Pakistani, Bangladeshi, Indian and many European nationalities. The Society aims to challenge all forms of discrimination and social exclusion through the provision of diverse and reactive services, delivered by a team of qualified social workers, nurses and other professionals.

properties.name: Northmoor Community Laundrette
properties.description: Northmoor Laundrette is managed by Northmoor Community Association, a local independent charity that also runs Northmoor Community Centre where a wide variety of activities and courses are available, as well as providing a meeting venue for Community Groups. The Laundrette is an outreach point for the Community Centre to reach local people, and it helps to raise funds to keep the Community Centre running.

properties.name: Wesley Community Furniture
properties.description:
Wesley is a Furniture Reuse Organisation, a charity that supplies furniture, domestic appliances, household goods and clothing at the lowest possible prices to those in greatest need, from all over the City of Manchester and beyond. We strive to provide the cheapest reusable furniture in Manchester – and to Reuse and Recycle as much of the material we collect as possible.
Our vans can collect donations of most household items FREE OF CHARGE throughout the Greater Manchester/N Cheshire area. These are then sorted, stored and sold from our shops and often delivered by our vans to those in need.
Most of the charity’s work is carried out by volunteers, and all the money we make is used so that we can provide the service.

properties.name: Salmagundi Films
properties.description:
Salmagundi Films is an established not for profit participatory arts organisation, founded by Bo Chapman and Zoe Flynn who have been championing the fundamental links between Arts, Health and Wellbeing since 2004.Their Frames of Mind ® (FOM) projects and training programmes, use film, stop frame animation and digital art as a platform for meaningful creative expression, for all ages and abilities. 
http://salmagundifilms.co.uk/Campaigns

They have pioneered the use of stop frame animation as a therapeutic communication and life story tool for families living with dementia; using significant personal objects and photographs as a catalyst for narrative.
Working With Dementia: http://salmagundifilms.co.uk/Working-with-Dementia
Salmagundi Films work to peoples strengths never underestimating what is possible, promoting ‘Art for Purpose’ and digital inclusion to foster vibrant, resilient and connected communities.

properties.name: Akwaaba
properties.addr:housenumber: Princess May Primary School, Entrance (off Stoke Newington Road),
properties.description: Akwaaba is a Hackney-based social centre for refugees, asylum seekers and other migrants. Akwaaba is a safe and welcoming space for people of all backgrounds—and of all faiths and none. Our members are drawn from nearly 50 countries. The aim of Akwaaba is to reduce social isolation, foster solidarity and offer practical and emotional support to vulnerable members of our community. Akwaaba is run entirely by volunteers and we try to give all members an equal say in how the social centre is run.

properties.name: Akwaaba Bike Workshop
properties.addr:housenumber: Princess May Primary School, Barrett's Grove Entrance (off Stoke Newington Road),
properties.contact:phone: Princess May Primary School, Barrett's Grove Entrance (off Stoke Newington Road),
properties.description: Since April 2016 we’ve been running a bike project providing free reconditioned bikes (subject to availability) to those that need them. Every 1st and 3rd Sunday of the month we also run a workshop at Akwaaba, where our bike volunteers offer on the spot bike repairs, informal basic bike maintenance and repairs training, and cycling proficiency lessons – for both adults and children.

properties.name: English for Action EFA London,
properties.description:
English for Action run free ESOL (English for Speakers of Other Languages) courses for adults in London.

Our teaching approach 
We have a unique pedagogy and years of experience delivering accessible community ESOL. Our approach blends participatory adult education and community organising.

Action
We support our participants to take action to improve their lives and their communities.

properties.name: Xenia
properties.description:
Xenia brings migrant, refugee, asylum-seeking & British women together for workshops that encourage English language practice & fun, meaningful two-way social integration.

Xenia is an Ancient Greek word meaning hospitality, love and respect between hosts and guests. It recognises and celebrates difference, encouraging people from different places to learn from one another’s cultures.

To us, Xenia is a community of women who welcome, listen, learn, support and share. The values below have been decided by Xenia women throughout workshops together:

We welcome all women
We value everyone’s experiences and knowledge
We take time to listen and understand
We all have something to teach
We all have something to learn
Our model means that participants learning English will be paired up with English-speaking women, taking part in the workshop together to jointly navigate language, activities and stories. Any woman can take part in Xenia, simple by attending one of our workshops. We welcome all women, including:

Migrant, refugee, asylum-seeking and British women
Trans and cisgender women, and non-binary people
Speakers and learners of all languages, including English
Disabled women and women of all abilities
LGBTQ+ women and straight women
Mothers, who are welcome to bring their children.

properties.name: TRiFOCAL London – Transforming City FOod hAbits for Life,
properties.description:
A new London-wide behaviour change initiative could save Londoners £330m, reduce avoidable food waste in the capital and increase awareness of more healthy and sustainable eating. 

London households throw away an estimated 900,000 tonnes of food each year, of which 540,000 tonnes could have been eaten. Not only is this environmentally damaging but it’s a huge waste of money for consumers, local authorities and businesses*. 

TRiFOCAL London – Transforming City FOod hAbits for Life, is the latest initiative to be led by Resource London - the partnership between WRAP and LWARB - together with Groundwork London.  The organisations bid for and won €3.2million from the European Commission* to deliver the initiative in London, which will be a test bed for other European cities.  

For the first time messages on how Londoners can reduce the amount of food they waste will be joined up with messages on how they can recycle the food waste that couldn’t be avoided, whilst also integrating messages about healthy sustainable eating. This is an exciting opportunity to help Londoners make changes for the better.  By the end of the initiative, a ‘food waste behavioural change resource bank’ will be developed, which can be used to help other European cities replicate the achievements of London. 

The initiative aims to use innovative approaches to:

1. Prevent food waste by changing planning, shopping, storage and meal preparation behaviour

2. Promote healthy and sustainable eating by changing purchasing and preparation practices 

3. Recycle more unavoidable food waste

Starting in September 2016 and running for three years, TRiFOCAL will engage with 33 London boroughs including householders, hospitality and food service businesses, local communities and schools.  It will use a range of communications approaches, including events, advertising and direct engagement with residents.

properties.name: Paper Round
properties.description:
Paper Round was started as a Friends of the Earth project in 1988, specifically to provide high quality environmental services to offices in London. Today we are still pioneers and innovators and keep ahead of the curve in waste management and in strategies for client engagement. BPR Group is our umbrella company and Secure Paper is our sister brand. Secure Paper is the confidential waste division of the group, whilst Paper Round provides recycling collections and green office supplies.

In 2013 we invested £2m in a fully enclosed, operational hub for our new Materials Recycling Facility and state-of-the-art secure shredding depot, allowing us to self-deliver across all of our services.

We are determined, passionate, skilled and experienced; by choosing Paper Round as your service provider you will achieve an unbeatable standard throughout your waste management scheme.

properties.name: Paper Round
properties.description:
Paper Round was started as a Friends of the Earth project in 1988, specifically to provide high quality environmental services to offices in London. Today we are still pioneers and innovators and keep ahead of the curve in waste management and in strategies for client engagement. BPR Group is our umbrella company and Secure Paper is our sister brand. Secure Paper is the confidential waste division of the group, whilst Paper Round provides recycling collections and green office supplies.

In 2013 we invested £2m in a fully enclosed, operational hub for our new Materials Recycling Facility and state-of-the-art secure shredding depot, allowing us to self-deliver across all of our services.

We are determined, passionate, skilled and experienced; by choosing Paper Round as your service provider you will achieve an unbeatable standard throughout your waste management scheme.

properties.name: Breadwinners
properties.description:
USING OUR LOAVES TO EMPOWER UNEMPLOYED REFUGEES INTO SUPPORTIVE WORK THROUGH OUR ARTISAN BREAD STALLS ACROSS LONDON’S BEST MARKETS.
95% of people in London buy bread everyday. Wouldn’t it be great if all these sales could somehow help the most vulnerable in society?

Breadwinners is a grass roots charity with a no-brainer model to make this a reality. We provide training and jobs for refugees across our London farmers market stalls. This gives our Breadwinners a safe and supportive place to work, where they can really build their confidence, learn new skills and get the experience they need to get a good job or set up a business so they can have a much deserved fresh start! 
50% OF REFUGEES BETWEEN THE AGE OF 18 AND 34 STRUGGLE TO FIND ANY WORK, DESPITE SEARCHING ON AVERAGE FOR 21 MONTHS.
"WE WORK WITH THE MOST MOTIVATED, DRIVEN AND RELIABLE PEOPLE...THEY JUST HAPPEN TO BE REFUGEES."

properties.name: Impact Hub King's Cross
properties.description:
We believe a better world is created through the combined accomplishments of creative, committed and compassionate individuals focused on a common purpose.
An innovation lab. A business Incubator. A social enterprise community centre. We offer you a unique ecosystem of resources, inspiration, and collaboration opportunities to grow your impact. Our diverse community will inspire, connect, and enable you to develop your best work every step of the way.

REACH A NETWORK OF 15,000+ MEMBERS
Connect with a rich local and global network of 15,000+ members and, with help from a dedicated Impact Hub host, make meaningful professional connections along every step of your entrepreneurial journey.


GAIN VIRTUAL BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES
Access virtual business opportunities through Impact Hub's collaborative platform and curated member directory, which tells you what you need to know about every investor, entrepreneur, corporation, impact professional, techie, freelancer, creative, innovator, and everyone else that makes up the Impact Hub community.


WORK AND MEET IN ANY LOCAL IMPACT HUB
Receive a "passport" to meet and work in any local Impact Hub space in 72 cities (and counting!)

properties.name: Pants to Poverty
properties.contact:phone: Change the world one pair of pants at a time, buying them from a democratic welfare state like the UK.  It's possible to buy all the parts, including raw microfibre, made in the UK, but there isn't a cheap range of welfare state pants in the shops. This site might help.  The three titles above - shopping, jobs, and poverty bonds, are links to separate pages. This shopping page lists some sites where you can buy pants made in a democratic welfare state; the jobs page lists some ideas for reducing UK poverty apart from the welfare state, and the bonds page shows accounts of previous companies that sold poverty bonds.
properties.description:
Change the world one pair of pants at a time, buying them from a democratic welfare state like the UK.

It's possible to buy all the parts, including raw microfibre, made in the UK, but there isn't a cheap range of welfare state pants in the shops. This site might help.

The three titles above - shopping, jobs, and poverty bonds, are links to separate pages. This shopping page lists some sites where you can buy pants made in a democratic welfare state; the jobs page lists some ideas for reducing UK poverty apart from the welfare state, and the bonds page shows accounts of previous companies that sold poverty bonds.

properties.name: Ethical Fashion Forum
properties.description:
What is Ethical Fashion?

Ethical Fashion Forum still have a page urging people not to buy from the UK on ethical grounds, even though the UK is a democratic welfare state. They lobby to promote goods made in badly-run countries.
So what is ethical fashion? With luck they'll change their idea of what "ethical fashion" means or "throw in the towel" as one quote said they might do. The new director mentions "sustainable fashion" more. Meanwhile here are some ethical fashion definitions.

Here is something about an ethical fashion forum "made in Britain" page and my draft notes in progress are here.

There are some notes on Ethical Fashion Forum's affect on jobs & poverty, then a long list of their implausible statements & silences. The source of their funding and early govenment backing gets a mention, too. If you want to jump to the juicy bit: Ethical Fashion Forum Fibs & Grand Distractions are what they use to divert attention from their implausible statements & silences. The section goes-on to a bit about courtiers and the strange similarity between the courts of god-kings who had their heads cut-off and the courtiers who commission Ethical Fashion Forum. There is a footnote about laws that apply to advertisers that I guess don't always apply to a pressure group. Greenwash & ethics wash are the usual terms; ethics wash applies here.

properties.name: Louis Farouk Shop
properties.description:
“Have nothing in your house that you do not know to be useful, or believe to be beautiful” 
William Morris
We like to think that this maxim could be applied to all the products we design, ethically source and sell at Louis Farouk, our small, independent boutique in leafy North London.

Our eclectic range of jewellery, clothing, accessories and homewares are either designed in-house and manufactured by artisans in Egypt and India, or carefully selected from other makers to complement our products.
The collection is whimsical, colourful and original and since we deal directly with the makers our prices are fair to both the creator and the customer.
This site is a tiny window to showcase our style. We will be adding products and eventually creating an online store but in the meantime please get in touch if you have product queries. Ideally come and visit us in Highbury, N5.

properties.name: First Mile
properties.description:
We believe in a world where you can recycle everything, and we're on a journey to make that a reality. 
First Mile was built to make it easy for businesses to recycle. Easy means giving businesses recycling collections when they want them. Easy means providing amazing customer service 24/7. Easy means using only the best facilities and processes to recycle waste and making sure everyone knows exactly what happens to their waste. Easy is working out how to recycle specialist materials.
And we don't just make recycling easy, we also recycle right. On average we recycle 66% of all the material we collect. That compares to an average recycling rate of just 33% in London. And for most, our 3 core recycling services - mixed recycling, food recycling and zero-to-landfill waste - will get you recycling more than 90% of the waste you produce. All of your recycling goes to state-of-the-art sorting and processing facilities, our main partner being Bywaters in East London. Absolutely nothing at all goes to landfill. Whatever we can't recycle is used to produce green energy. And we're carbon neutral. We're as green as you get.

properties.name: WCRS Waste Cost Reduction Service
properties.description: Waste Cost Reduction Services (WCRS) provides high quality, cost effective and fully compliant recycling and waste management solutions to businesses with multiple waste streams and multiple sites across the UK. We aim to reduce our customers’ expenditure on waste through a range of sustainable recycling and waste management services based on careful management and customer focus. Our team has extensive knowledge of waste and recycling and can call on the services of our network of over 500 regional and local suppliers to provide you with an independent and truly bespoke recycling and waste management solution.

properties.name: Output Arts
properties.description:
Output Arts is an art collective founded in 2009. We make site-specific, interactive and participatory audiovisual artworks and experiences.

We engage in a process of collaboration and refinement that brings together traditional and modern artistic techniques. We work with a variety of physical and time-based material –  sometimes researched from a community through sensitive questioning – and combine this with thoughtful and careful use of digital technology.

Through this, we generate playful and poignant artworks that distil the enormity of an idea – such as the experience of loss or the wind – into an intimate contemplation. We create surprising and accessible artworks that encourage our audience to be active agents in the discovery of stories that unfold over time.

Output Arts is a UK registered partnership between artists Andy D'Cruz and Jonathan Hogg.

properties.name: Women for Refugee Women
properties.description:
Women for Refugee Women challenges the injustices experienced by women who cross borders to seek safety. We work in three ways:

We work at the grassroots to support and empower women who are seeking asylum.

We work with the arts, media and public events to tell women’s stories.

And, by publishing research and informing politicians, we try to create a fairer asylum process.
EMPOWER
Women for Refugee Women works directly with women who seek asylum. We support two grassroots groups in London, Women Asylum Seekers Together London and the London Refugee Women’s Forum. More than 70 women come to these groups every week for English classes, advice, lunch and other projects such as craft and drama.
INFLUENCE
We create ground breaking public events and arts projects to ensure that the experiences of refugee women are heard by wide audiences. We have run drama, craft and photography projects with refugee women, and worked with actresses to tell the stories of women who are locked up in Yarl’s Wood. We work throughout the mainstream media, including press, TV and radio.
CHANGE
Our research has significantly changed people’s understanding of the experiences of refugee women. Our work has been quoted in both houses of Parliament over the last few years and we work with politicians from all major parties to try to move towards a fairer asylum process.

properties.name: East London Dance
properties.description:
In the UK’s fastest-changing community we bring dance to people and people to dance, producing ambitious performances that attract wide audiences alongside projects to get all ages dancing.

Uncovering diverse talent, we train young professionals, develop their careers and watch them fly.

We collaborate widely and attract world-class choreographers and artists to come and work with us. Across the dance world, and among our audiences and participants, we make friendships, partnerships and inspired connections.

Take your dance journey with us.

Where we work
We are based in the heart of Stratford in the borough of Newham, with offices at Stratford Circus Arts Centre. We don’t run our own venue and this gives us huge flexibility to pop up anywhere across eight east London boroughs (and occasionally further afield) allowing us to really embed ourselves in our local community.
Everyone has the right to dance.

Whether we are creating, participating or watching – dance can be enjoyed by all. It is exercise, it is entertainment, it is art, it is social change. Dance can thrill, tell stories, educate and inspire, it is liberating, energising, inclusive and fun.

Dance transcends language barriers and crosses cultural borders. A universal language that speaks to something deep within us all, it brings people and communities together and is as diverse as the people who do it.

Dance brings us closer to music and has the power to improve our physical health and mental wellbeing. It is whatever our bodies will allow. It can take a lifetime to perfect, but be picked up in seconds. It can start with a toe tap yet, with unlimited possibilities, stretch the human body to its very limits. It is the ultimate form of personal expression.

We love dance, it changes lives for the better and we believe that everyone has the right to access its benefits.

properties.name: Resonate Arts
properties.description:
Resonate Arts is Westminster Arts’ pioneering programme of innovative arts based activities and experiences for people living with dementia in the boroughs of Westminster, Kensington & Chelsea and
​Hammersmith & Fulham.
​
​We believe engagement in the arts and creativity has enduring effects on wellbeing, health and quality of life, and we endeavour to be a catalyst for positive change, to reduce social isolation and build strong communities.
How we work
Resonate Arts offers a range of arts projects and hands-on creative opportunities for people at all stages of care from diagnosis onwards. Devised in 2009, Resonate Arts was initially developed to support the delivery of the National Dementia Strategy in the City of Westminster. 
Since 2015 we have been working across the tri-borough area, funded by the Central London, West London, and Hammersmith & Fulham Clinical Commissioning Groups, plus a range of trusts and foundations.

Activities
Our programme of activities range from group sessions in community settings to one-to-one interventions for people living in their own homes who are at risk of isolation. We work across the arts on projects such as music, visual arts, poetry, dance, performing arts and more. Activities are designed to enhance and compliment individual care plans, and help people to feel part of their wider community.

Resonate Arts regularly exhibits artwork created during projects and contribute to magazines etc and speak about the work at conferences and events. We offer listings and events during Dementia Awareness Week and Creative and Wellbeing Week. We also support the Dementia Action Alliances in Westminster and Kensington and Chelsea. We take part in local and national initiatives such as health fairs, Big Draw and Silver Sunday.

Referrals to our service
People are referred to the programme through a range of services including the Dementia Advisors, Memory Services, Admiral nurses, Community Mental Health Teams, outreach workers and voluntary organisations such as Open Age or Octavia Housing.

properties.name: Equal Arts
properties.description:
We are a leading creative ageing charity supporting older people and those living with dementia in Gateshead, Newcastle and across the UK.

Our team works to improve the lives of older people through creativity and our arts activities around the country provide creative opportunities to help improve people's wellbeing.

Memory may diminish but imagination remains.
Our work focuses on giving people the opportunity to explore their imagination and live in the moment.

We strongly believe in the health benefits of the arts and support care staff and artists to deliver musical, visual and movement-based creative activities with active older people and those living with dementia.

"We have worked hand in hand with Equal Arts for the past five years and we understand and actively support meaningful activities for people who use our service."
"From the service users and the staff team at Shadon, I would like to express our thanks to the charity for providing new stimulating ideas for us all to enjoy and participate in."
"We have shared our approach to supporting and enabling people with many other care settings and would actively encourage them to create links with Equal Arts and embrace their support."

properties.name: Daily Life Ltd
properties.description:
Daily Life Ltd. was founded in 1995 to support the production and touring of Bobby Baker’s artworks. Baker makes art about everyday life that is highly innovative in how it’s made and where it’s shown – aiming to “create great art that reaches the parts other art doesn’t reach”.
